name: 3Two4L
text: Great hospitality and definitely make it a fun time while helping you recover! If there were 100 stars on here I’d give them 1000!

name: Derrick Griffie
text: The staff and leadership are very knowledgeable and does a great job of teaching you how to become effective in your own training and development. They partner with you to get you healed and teach you how to recognize when and if the problem may occur again. Love them so much!

name: Jean Cox
text:
The Therapist I have worked with exclusively has been Richard. He has been awesome to work with and pushes me but does take into consideration my overall pain level from  previous surgeries that has left me with chronic pain. The room and equipment is constantly being cleaned! Overall rating is definitely a *10+ I’ve also worked with another girl several times and she really pushes me to improve which I like!

This past week has definitely had its challenges.. flat tire and husband is disabled and couldn’t change the tire!

name: Montrice Lucas
text: Amazing therapist that are very courteous!!! Everyone works together to help the patients. The atmosphere is awesome! Everyone seems to love what they do and love working with each other! Not only that, the therapy is working!

name: Aimee Martin
text: Very flexible with school schedule!  My daughter feels like she is going to see her friends rather than a therapist. Great professionals who take the time to explain everything that they are doing. Getting my daughter better!!!

name: Cathy Fine
text: Trussville ATI Physical Therapy is absolutely wonderful! All the therapists and staff are so caring and really go the extra mile to help you.

name: Jan Sims
text: The best Therapists you will find. With their knowledge & pooling of information & modalities I have a chance to avoid surgery! Thanks Team ATI!

name: Dave Hammond
text: Great staff and very knowledgeable. Your success is their primary goal.

name: Phillip Perkins
text: The program they put me on is helping me with my condition. I would recommend them to everyone.

name: Morris Perry
text: My physical therapist Richard is amazing. I will definitely recommend him in you come into the North Trussville ATI Therapy location.

name: Randy Bryant
text: Always fantastic service and results.  Wouldn’t go anywhere else to keep me in the game.

name: Rodney Davis
text: They are very nice and friendly but emtirely to many patients per Therapist. They get things confused, forget about where you are in your activities, evaluation is very unclear and no clear instructions on what to do on your own once you leave.

name: Jay Moore
text: Physical Therapy with Richard has really improved my range of motion. He takes his time to make sure that I get back to 100% in record timing.

name: Hannah George
text: Can’t say enough good about the team at ATI Happy Hollow!! The PTs are knowledgeable, personable, hilarious, kind, and everything you could want in a physical therapy experience. Thanks to Beth, Alyssa, Kelton, Brian, Kacy (and Ryan!) for all their hard work and fun times!

name: Crystal Johnson
text: My daughter goes and she's 15 and she 💘 💘 love them

resp.text: Thank you for this positive rating!

name: Jennfier Powell
text: I would recommend ATI physical therapy to my friends and family.  The staff is courteous and understanding.  Everyone is friendly.  The place is clean and organized.  IF I ever have to have therapy again, I will be using ATI.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

name: Sudsy Warrior
text: I came here after my first surgery and was very nervous and quiet for the first few weeks but eventually I opened up and got to know all the workers and they are all amazing! Not only do they care about the patients and know what to do for every injury, they are also very kind and know how to make you laugh especially Ryan, Brian, and Kacy! I couldn’t recommend this place more 10/10!

name: David Simmons
text: If I could give 10 stars I would do it. This place is amazing, Brian, Casey, Ryan and the rest of the team are the best. They truly care about their patients, and no matter how busy they are, they are always so nice and do their jobs with a smile on their faces.

name: malachi roegner
text: Best physical therapy place I have been too and has the nicest and most helpful people like Brain, Casey, and Ryan they help you a lot and make your physical therapy experience much better.

text: I have never had a positive experience with physical therapy until I began treatment at this location with Brian.  It is obvious he is very experienced and cares about his patients.  They don’t just give you simple exercises you can do on your own in the gym; but tailer a program where you will see results.

name: michael allison
text: Well the care may be good, but the fact you get put on hold and we will call you back SUCK"s, i am looking for my wife as we speak and can not find her, via cell phone or ATI answering service,  her appointment was at 4:30 it is now 6:48pm. I am not happy.

name: Laura L
text: I cannot heap enough praise about the physical therapists, staff and facility at St. Vincent’s. After undergoing a bad ankle break and surgery with hardware, I could barely walk and was in constant pain.  Tyler helped me through the process, from basic mobility exercises to advanced balance and strength training.  He was always so positive and encouraging, making a difficult and depressing time in my recovery less insurmountable.  I looked forward to my sessions at ATI – everyone was so supportive and friendly.  I also appreciated the variety of equipment (especially the blood flow restriction apparatus).   Motivating, energetic environment with skilled, compassionate staff all the way around.  Highly recommend x100!

name: Jennifer Kendall
text: ATI was extremely professional, flexible with my schedule, and overall very helpful. This was my second time using them. My husband and I both used to them two years ago as well and we would definitely Continue to use them in the future if needed

text: From the initial consultation  about my proposed treatment plan to implementation of the treatment, the service was excellent. I also like that my assigned home exercise can be downloaded on the ITA portal, with models detailing how to perform each exercise correctly.

text:
ATI located on the St. Vincent's Hospital campus in Birmingham, Alabama is one of the best physical therapy facilities From which I have received rehabilitative care.  Sarah Schmidt is the best therapist with which I have ever worked.  I have worked with her on 3 separated occasions and she is an expert at what she does.

The facility is equipped with a well trained staff and is capable of any type of rehab work needed.    When you are a patient at this ATI clinic,  you're treated with dignity, respect, and concern.  There number one goal is your care, your progress, and  how you are feeling.  As long as Sarah Schmidt is there, I will continue to use ATI.

Steve (Therapist) is very helpful and knowledgeable with answering all of my questions and concerns. He is helpful in guiding me through all the rehabilitation exercises and stretches. When i experience pain he let me know why and insure me it will go away. He was right. I informed him of all my doctor visits, results, and we work from there.
He really care and want to see my performance get better. He is very personable and isn't afraid to touch and stretch my shoulder.
I would recommend ATI Physical Therapy at St Vincent in Birmingham Alabama  to anyone needing rehabilitation help. All theTherapist and the two Receptionist are very professional and helpful to me

Glad we decided to come here!! Thanks Stephen for everything and working to get “Jr.”, as you call him back in shape in no time!!!

I would definitely recommend this hospital to friends.

name: April Baker
text: I do quite a lot of notary work at Encompass and have never had anything but positive experiences with their staff. They are always kind, thoughtful and considerate to their patients and family of their patients. They jump through hoops to fill the needs of their patients  while still managing to keep everyone involved safe and socially distant. Y’all are amazing!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing, April!

name: Big P Bullwinkle, Jr.
text:
My mother was discharged from Encompass 4 days ago. I will start by saying everyone I was in contact with was extremely friendly and kind. Case Manager and front desk were my favorite folks. My mother was there for 2 weeks. She received several hours of PT/OT therapy per day. Based on the reports of her progress while there, I was under the impression my mother would come home being able to do most things..simple things...walk to the bathroom...dress herself...on her own with supervision. NOT THE CASE. The first couple days home so far have been hell. My mother is far more dependent and way less capable of caring for herself than she was when she was admitted two weeks ago. She walked into the last doctors appointment before being admitted to Encompass. Now, she can barely walk to the bathroom. Definitely not the outcome I had anticipated....sorry to say.

re·ha·bil·i·ta·tion
/ˌrē(h)əˌbiləˈtāSH(ə)n/
noun
the action of restoring someone to health or normal life through training and therapy after imprisonment, addiction, or illness.

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your concerns with us. We have forwarded this information to the appropriate contacts. If you’d like to share additional details, please email us directly at feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: VICKI BREWER
text: My uncle was in after a traumatic brain injury. The staff for the most part were excellent and any problems were quickly resolved. The therapists did a wonderfully job. If he ever has to go again I only want him at Encompass

resp.text: So glad to hear your uncle's experience at Encompass Health North Alabama was great! Thanks for sharing, Vicki.

name: Ken Hamilton
text: I would NOT recommend this facility.  We were only allowed to visit one time (I understand the reason).  The staff was very nice.  While we where there, they never came in to turn him or get him up.  The reports we were given on a daily basis, was very encouraging.  We were informed by the case management team, that the family member was doing very well.  We were also given a report that the family member would only need a little help walking, feeding themselves, and sitting up.  The family member would need more assistance in other areas of activity.  Once we got the family member home, we was total bed ridden.  It took two people  to get him up or to move him.  When the home health nurse came to the house, she confirmed that she had also been told the same thing that we had been told.  The family member also had a wound to his heel and signs of break down on his back (the family member was only at Encompass for 10 days).  After completing Encompass' survey, I received a telephone call from someone saying she was from Encompass and wanted to talk to me about the survey.  After talking to me, she stated that she would investigate the issues and call me back in a couple of days.  It has now been over 2 weeks, and I have not hear back from her.  If I know then what I know now about Encompass, I would never had allowed my family member to go there.

name: Donna Traylor
text: I had 2 strokes I a row (smaller ones), this fall.  Huntsville Hospital referred me to Encompass for rehab.  I was scared!  Being in a new place was very scary for me.  I was pleasantly surprised, actually the nursing care I received was excellent! The doctor and nurse practitioner were very, very caring.  I recommend this rehab and give it a 5+ stars!  The aids, cleaning staff, maintenance dept, nurses, techs, physical therapists, and occupational therapists are AWESOME!  Thank you Shannon, ( my occupational therapists!  I was very off balance and unable to do much at all, before Encompass!  Thank you and God bless you all!

resp.text: Donna, thank you so much for sharing your positive experience at our Huntsville hospital. Thank you for entrusting us with your care!

name: Dale Lowe
text: I found that every aspect of my rehab was handled very professional and the staff made the rehab enjoyable as you could have hoped for.  The nursing and the staff are top notch!

resp.text: Dale, thank you so much for sharing your positive experience at our Huntsville hospital! We agree that our Encompass Health team is the best.

name: Lynn Johnson
text: It’s a great facility with very friendly, helpful staff. They did a great job helping our loved one get stronger to prepare for double knee replacement surgery. The therapists worked with her a lot to help her reduce her pain and chances of falling. Once she gets the surgery done, I hope they send her back there to recover. I would definitely recommend Encompass.

name: Mary Smith
text: Horrible place to work for nurses at the Huntsville, AL location. Good pay, but if you are not in their "clique" the employees start to bully you, trying to get you to quit. If you do not quit and are a good employee (good work, no absences, not late), you still get put on probation with no explanation (in the facility(90 days)-not towards licensing-being a single-mom I had no other choice but to accept it). However, people that are constantly late, call in alot,are lazy, etc, move up in the company. Very unprofessional and backwards place to work.

resp.text: Mary, thank you for sharing feedback with us. We've passed this information along to the appropriate contacts as the behavior described does not align with our Company values. If you'd like to provide additional details, please email feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: Jane Thurmer
text: We could not be happier with the great care our mother has received at this rehab facility after her total hip replacement.  Thank you all for your attention to every detail of her care and especially the great planning for care at home after her discharge!

name: Calethea Martin
text: My husband is currently at healthsouth now and he has done just awesome since he has been there. This is a great rehab facility.

name: Jeff K
text:
My son was in HealthSouth. It's an aggressive program and very well suited for young people who heal fast. I don't think it would be that great for the very elderly who have physical injuries except in the right circumstances.

My son had a brain injury, bruised spleen, and broken ribs. The physical therapists didn't believe that he had broken ribs. I was told that the pain he was feeling was in his mind due to his brain injury. This was not true. The doctor who first examined him at Huntsville Hospital verified that he had broken ribs on both sides. HealthSouth was either ignorant or chose to ignore this fact until I chewed some ass and got him some pain medication. They even brought in a portable x-ray machine and still said he had no broken ribs. The physical therapists tried to move him around and were too aggressive for someone in that kind of pain.

I don't know if they lie as a part of their aggressive approach, or if it was a mistake. It's hard to believe it was a mistake when it was in his medical record that his ribs were broken.

Most of the staff is nice and helpful. A couple of them were rude but you get that anywhere.

resp.text: Jeff, we are sorry to hear about your family's experience. This does not align with our Company values and we have forwarded this information to the appropriate contacts. We do use intensive therapy as part of our approach to returning patients of all ages back to their optimal level of independence. We do not encourage aggressiveness and in no way condone overlooking important information in a patient's file. If you'd like to provide additional details, we encourage you to email us directly at feedback@encompasshealth.com.

name: Ty Farr
text: Would never recommend this rehab hospital to work.

resp.text: Ty, we'd appreciate the opportunity to learn more about your experience with our Huntsville hospital location. Please email us directly with additional details to feedback@encompasshealth.com.

text: About this time last year I had a spinal injury I'm not like I was but I have to give a thanks to my  ooccupational and physical therapist that worked with me if wasn't for you and my determination I can't imagine what shape I'd be today thank you !

name: Erica Adcock
text: Jazma and all the employees at the Gadsden location are absolutely wonderful and great at what they do. My daughter was set to have her tailbone removed, a super bad break she suffered 6 years ago, where she broke her tailbone in, instead of out. She remained a multi sport athlete through all of the pain until she recently graduated high school. We are so grateful for Jazma and Nicole and how they saved my daughter, who is healthy other than the tailbone issue, from at minimum 3 separate surgeries!!! Not 1 of the 3 separate doctors we saw, even offered or mentioned leukotape as an option to heal my child. She has had no real relief with the pain so when Jazma first taped her and she stood up, she was teary eyed because it helped her pain level decrease immensely!! There is no amount of thanks I can give to these amazing people at Therapy South!! They actually care about you!!!!

text: I could not be more thankful to have found TherapySouth! Her kind compassionate care along with her gift of teaching and explaining how each muscle works together to impact some of the pain I was experiencing made all the difference in my experience and care at Therapy South! I highly recommend anyone considering care there!

text: Wonderful atmosphere and culture,  friendly professionals who are genuinely concerned with your improvement.

name: Elizabeth Ford
text: I started seeing Dr. Jazma Dobbins McBurnett last summer when I was about 18 weeks pregnant. I started experiencing SI joint pain on my runs early on in the pregnancy, and honestly wasn't the best at strength training prior to pregnancy. Jazma  helped relieve and prevent pain.  I can't imagine what the pregnancy would have felt like if I had not had the privilege of seeing her. She is great at  educating and empowering her patients As someone who works in healthcare myself, I highly value holistic and preventative treatments to improve quality of life.  I resumed seeing her postpartum (after a traumatic birth) and she's been so incredibly kind, supportive and sweet!  The  entire staff, PTAs, techs and office coordinator are also  very pleasant , cheerful and positive! I feel so fortunate and blessed to be able to receive care  from the staff there!

name: Wendy Wallace
text: Absolutely wonderful therapists! Jazma has totally changed my life. I suffered with problems with the muscles of my pelvic floor. After years of surgeries and finally a hysterectomy I can honestly say I knew pain. I didn't even know there was physical therapy for this. Since going my muscles have loosened. They are working on the years of built up scar tissue that was hindering me from enjoying life. She set me up with the tools and knowledge of what I needed to do at home and helped me understand what my own body was telling me. I'm 45 years old and finally able to enjoy some simple pleasures that others take for granted. Im so very thankful to therapy south and especially Jazma and Hannah! Highly recommend to anyone needing physical therapy for any reason. They are the best!

name: Faith Morris
text: Wonderful, caring, and kind staff. Jazma listened to my concerns and was extremely knowledgeable in developing a plan of action to get me back in motion.

name: Mark Brooks
text: There is a noticeable difference between TherapySouth and other physical therapy clinics (Jazma, Hannah and Mike are the team you are looking for if you are trying to decide where to have your physical therapy!).  From previous surgeries I completed physical therapy at four other clinics and none of them approached the healing process like TherapySouth.  What I mean is, all of the other clinics would usually measure progress to start and then go straight to exercises with heat or ice at the end.  TherapySouth, however, adds a key component that I never knew was missing until I went there for therapy after my third shoulder surgery.  They take a very hands on approach and actually work/massage the muscles to get them going again.  This was not just for one visit because I slept on it wrong, this is the attention you get every single appointment and it is such a difference maker!  Trust me, TherapySouth in Gadsden is the best place for physical therapy.

name: Amanda Nelson
text: Jazma is amazing ! A true heart for healing people ! I highly recommend Therapy South for any therapy needs !!

name: Donna Underwood
text: I can't say enough great things about Jazma Dobbins and her team at Therapy South. When my husband started therapy for stiffness due to Parkinson desease, he was using a cane and walking extremely slow. Jazma routinely treats and advises him utilizing LSVT therapy for his Parkinson's which definitely keeps the desease from advancing quicker. Magic Mike has worked with my husband's stiff hip and leg muscles. I can see where Mike got his nickname because Randy put the cane down after his therapy. Because of Jazma and her team, my husband and I are positively fighting the effects of Parkinson and living a much better quality of life. Thank you Therapy South for all you do!

text: Jazma Dobbins is a patient educator and an excellent therapist.  She says it best of her roll in overall health: “I just let you know that your body has what it takes to heal”.

name: Rita Daugherty
text:
** Why Therapy South - Gadsden **. Why Physical Therapy??? **

We are living in a high stress age where we all strive to succeed in life.  Many times we’re all guilty of putting our own lives on the back burner to please our employers and/or families, unfortunately compromising our own health.

But in reality we should be putting ourselves first for the sole purpose of better serving ourselves and others.

** Life is a work in Progress **

Initially I began physical therapy to address a single issue but along the way - I learned there are many more ways to alleviate pain and improve my health.  I was introduced to ‘Dry Needling’ which targeted and relieved pressure points. But during the therapy an exercise regiment was created which allowed me to focus on regaining my strength and endurance after battling the side effects of chemo and radiation.

Because of ‘Therapy South’s - Gadsden office” and outstanding staff - Jazma - Hannah - Kim & Mike - I was able to concentrate on regaining some of my strength and endurance through the exercise regiments they created specifically to address the issues. All four are outstanding beyond measure with their knowledge base and skill sets. Again - it’s a work in progress.

Two of primary doctors were beyond estatic upon learning about the maintenance program ‘Therapy South - Gadsden’ provides.  I feel like I literally lost a year of maintenance after a former PT group didn’t provide the maintence program which for me is an essential element in regaining what I lost while recovering from the side effects of chemo and radiation.

Looking forward to the future and will always be ‘Thankful’ for Jazma - Hannah - Mike and Kim.  We’re truly blessed to have them in our community!!  🌹🌹🌹🌹

Q

name: Karen Stanfield
text:
I can not say enough about how much Jazma and Hannah have helped me. When I first met Jazma, she did intense vestibular therapy with me for a concussion. It was a no brainer after I had orthopedic surgery that I wanted to use Jazma and Hannah at TherapySouth. They have helped me so much with my healing, recovery, and pain.
I have a 10 year old son with autism who is nonverbal. He had surgery on his legs and needed therapy. Although Jazma and Hannah don’t specifically specialize in pediatrics much less special needs pediatrics, they told me they were willing to work with my son to see how it went. Well, he has done amazing with them and loves going to therapy.
If you’re looking for a physical therapist, TherapySouth in Gadsden is the place to go! Jazma, Mike, and Hannah are 100% committed to their patients and Kim, who works upfront, makes sure she schedules you at the best time for your schedule.  They are a true asset to Gadsden and are second to none!

My son injured his Achilles playing baseball, and physical therapy was prescribed. This was the first time we’ve ever need physical therapy and we so surprised by the difference it makes. While my son was being treated, I was able to observe the team in action, and I was so impressed. After some rest and physical therapy, my son is back in action, and I’m so grateful for Atiba and everyone at ATI for playing a key part in his healing and being so encouraging and kind.

After about a month of sessions, I've had little to no pain and rarely need to take ibuprofen and today I "graduated" :D .

Kylie and Laura were my therapists and they were both very friendly. I'm shy to a fault, but they and the entire staff made me feel welcome and comfortable. The place is very organized and clean too. Overall, my experience with them was really nice I couldn't have asked for more.

name: Shannon Pierce
text: Wonderful staff!  I loved the one on one experience and caring of both my therapist and the front office staff.  Being disabled has given me a whole new outlook on budgeting and needing physical therapy can certainly hit that budget hard no matter how good your insurance.  I was given a breakdown of exactly how much I would owe for the full course of therapy and given a workable payment schedule.  The Therapist herself listened and worked with ALL my issues.  This made my experience much better since multiple surgeries have left me with limitations not always regarded by previous therapists.  It can be extremely painful trying to perform the necessary exercises to improve things that CAN be improved. That's just the nature of things, but pain trying to deal with what can't be changed while working on what can is avoidable.  My therapist at Results listened and did the work on her part required to make my evaluation as pain free as possible. Thank you, Results Physiotherapy!

resp.text: Thank you! Our team prides itself on helping others get better, faster!

text: I really can't say enough about Results Physiotherapy! It is such a blessing to find yourself in a place with people who care about you when you are physically hurting. Office staff is amazing, appointments are easy to get, and the therapists (Dominique Forté is my therapist) are incredible. They are professional yet it feels like a family. Everyone there is hoping and working for you to get better. They cheer you on when you struggle and celebrate you when you are doing well. From experience I know that if you are seeing a PT things are not going so great BUT... If you have the help like is offered at Results, you are going to be encouraged!   I actually feel like without Dominique I would have ended up having surgery on my neck. I'm so thankful that she was able to get me back to living a full/pain free life without having to go through that.

I would like to thank Dr Josh for the care that I received during my stay in Madison Al. Dr Josh treatments/ instructions were clear and he certainly had a strong understanding of my pain/discomfort and successfully increased my range of motion while decreasing my shoulder pain.  Everyone was gracious and kind, and I left the office a much happier person. Thank you so much for accommodating me. I am forever grateful.
I will be returning to Huntsville to hike/Trailblazer Make A Wish Challenge 26.2 Mile hike this year. Thanks again for your dedication to patient care.

name: d b
text: If you are looking for a quality physical therapist, look no further! 1st Step Physical Therapy & Sports Medicine provides a wonderful atmosphere and outstanding professional medical advisement for recovery from injuries. Josh has a wonderful fun loving personality and allows the patient to provide feedback and input regarding their treatment  plan to recovery. My experience here has made me not want to leave even after my treatment plan starts comes to a end.

name: Violet Schoonveld
text: I was not looking forward to my first major surgery at 77.  The problem was my right hip replacement.  When they originally thought my knee was the problem, physical therapy left no positive results.  A friend from church gave me a card for 1st Step and Dr. Josh Farhat.  He worked with her and still does.  When he worked with me, wow what a difference.  Josh took the time to explain my surgery and what to expect during therapy.  It was one-on-one with all the caring he could give.  As other patients arrived, the feeling was the same.  Here's a Doctor who cares and wants you to be your old, healthy self again.  I am now walking tall and straight and getting compliments from family and friends.  One thought comes to mid, call Josh at 1st Step Physical  Therapy and sweet Karla will make an appointment!!

name: Waikikita Tilley
text: When my primary doctor mentioned physical therapy, I was opposed to going, only because I thought physical therapy meant rehab with people very wise. lol! I knew my back pains were only getting worse and I had to do something.  Fast forward. I’ve been going weekly and it’s been absolutely rewarding. I’m progressing very well; and in time I know that I will be back to normal. The facility is very clean and the staff is phenomenal. Lastly, I always read reviews prior to giving a business an opportunity. Trust me, you will not be disappointed at 1st Step Physical Therapy.

name: Allison Sokol
text: I am an avid mountain biker.  Most avid mountain bikers, like myself, take trail options to improve our skill set.  Sometimes those options fail, but we usually brush ourselves off and session them again.  Unfortunately, my session resulted in a pretty serious neck and shoulder injury. From the time I returned from my ER visit to home, I started researching physical therapists.  Only going by reviews, and not from a referral, I made an excellent choice in a provider.  Dr. Josh is a very meticulous, extremely well-educated, well-informed, and experienced practitioner.  I trust VERY FEW people with my neck, I didn't even want the x-ray tech or the ER physician touching me.  But, Dr. Josh has a very patient and calm "chi" that enables you to relax while he gently tests your cervical range of motion.  Each body (or limb) exercise is thoroughly explained and tailored to your primary diagnosis and physical therapy goals.  You will know the why's, how's, duration, etc.  Have a question with anything?  Ask.  He is VERY thorough and VERY patient.  I have a ways to go because I have a challenging case, but I am so impressed with the  milestones I am reaching in such a short period of time!  Thank you Dr. Josh!

name: Nathan Dyer
text: My Achilles tendon ruptured just before Christmas 2018.  After the surgery to repair it in January, I searched for a PT not knowing much since it was my first major injury.  I found 1st Step and compared other local offices noticing that Josh was both the owner & the PT, not just one of a multi-person group.  Working only with Josh has been central to my great progress.  He genuinely cares about your complete recovery and is exceptionally knowledgeable in his field.  I highly recommend 1st Step for your physical therapy services.

name: Stephanie Ezell
text:
I was very pleased with my experiences and would highly recommend Dr. Josh Farhat at 1st Step Physical Therapy! They offer an awesome and professional staff and facility with great care!
*Highly Recommend!

name: Barbara Williams
text: I had extensive back surgery at Vanderbilt hospital in Nashville. It was 14 hours long, and My vertebrae was fused from C2 to T8. I was in terrible shape when I came out of hospital, and went to in house rehab at Health South for two weeks. I came out with a lot of pain, almost an invalid. I started using Dr Josh for my therapy, and he has me so much stronger and my pain has gotten better. He is the best by far of anyone that has worked on my back.

name: Michael Moore
text: Josh’s expertise was instrumental in getting my shoulder on the road to recovery after my arthoscopy. The dry needle therapy is a leading edge procedure that ably addressed the particular problems I was having with my back and shoulder muscles. Great experience!

name: Charlie Crowe
text: My shoulder pain was worsening. It was so bad that I had trouble putting on a shirt. I was afraid that I needed a costly surgery and long recovery. Dr. Josh Farhat quickly diagnosed me and assured me that he could rehab it. In under two months (probably close to 1 month), I was painless. I highly recommend Josh and this practice.

text: I have used their services for recovery after an achilles surgery and also for a recent shoulder injury and both times had great results. Nice facility and very professional staff. Highly recommend.

name: Marianne Davis
text: Madeline and Laurie are wonderful to work with! The rest of the staff was always very friendly. I have used this location of Results Physiotherapy for more than one injury, and as much as I hate to need PT,  I  know they will get me back in the gym!

resp.text: Thanks for the review! We continually strive to help people get back to living life pain free!

name: Z Coleman
text:
When I was rear-ended on Hwy. 280 back in November, my extremely busy, very physical lifestyle ground to a halt.  I couldn’t lift over 5 pounds when I first began treatment at Results PT.  Madeline Arnall was understanding when I tried to explain my pain and limited mobility in laymen’s terms.  She shared her plan for treatment and, along with Ms Lori, helped me regain flexibility and strength.  The two of them equipped me with information that applies to more than what initially brought me there; I learned more about my lifelong health and longevity during my appointments.  Physical therapy is challenging, and it was nice to have patient, understanding therapists to help me through the hard days.  We made plans to overcome setbacks and celebrated steps forward.  Looking back over the past few months, I would say that I am stronger now than before the car accident.  I showed up to my appointments and committed fully to their instructions and am glad to say that I am back to my busy, physically-demanding routine.

The rest of the staff was always respectful and professional.  Katie is fantastic at explaining all account information and it was fun to share a few laughs with her.  Also, Gracie the therapy dog is incredibly sweet, soft, and didn't smell like a dog at all! :)   The day she and I met is one day I needed her the most. Please thank her owner for sharing her!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review. We work hard to satisfy expectations, and we’re happy to hear when we help others get better, faster!

name: William Jernigan
text: The staff was very helpful, friendly, efficient, caring and at he same time professional. My wife is now attending and I would recommend them highly to anyone needing physical therapy

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words. We always try to help others get back to living without pain; so they can do the things they love!

name: Cathy Lakhani
text: Drum Roll...please meet my Ultimate Life Changing Super Heros. Michael Bagwell, Ariel Croom, and Jonathan Bush this amazing team changed my life. When I came to therapy I was a little hesitant but willing to try anything to feel better. I was in a car accident suffered head concussion effecting my vestibular system. I had no clue what vestibular therapy was. This team and entire staff are very professional, pleasant, and knowledgeable. I came in broken but today I am better. I'm enjoying my family, life and I'm back driving regularly. I'm forever grateful for each of you who labored with me  you all have made a huge difference in my life I will never forget you all and my Super Women Hero Samantha at the Hoover location who started the initial process. Thanks again, my forever Super Heroes! I highly recommend this location. Please check them out, sweet Katie at the front desk will absolutely make you feel like your at home. They win as a team!!! They help saved my life. Forever Grateful!! Amazing Gifts from God!!!

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review. We work hard to satisfy expectations, and we’re happy to hear when we help others get better, faster!

They even  made me a bday card on my bday & called me when I was sick. Madelyn is a terrific PT.   I would highly recommend her! Laurie my PTA is so kind.  Katie at front desk always greets me with a smile & knows everyone's name. High class place!

Wonderful staff.  Friendly, skilled, and helpful.  I am truly amazed at how much progress has been made in just 3 weeks!
The flexible hours made appts easy to fit my schedule! ❤️ Drayer!

resp.text: Karen - three cheers for you!  We are so proud of your progress and wish you the best!

name: Sandra Lynch
text:
I have used the Alabaster office after 2 knee replacement surgery and back pain. All three experiences have been excellent. They were very caring and through with my therapy.           Dr. Michael Patterson is an excellent surgeon and my aftercare at Drayer PT was exactly what I needed to recover my mobility and full range of motion. Thanks to everyone who works there.
If you are in need of PT this is definitely a great place and awesome service.

resp.text: Sandra - we are so happy to be on team "Sandra"!  Thank you so much for your kind words!

name: Crystal Marczewski
text: Went in after I hurt my back. They were all very professional and everyone is so nice. I actually enjoyed my visits.

resp.text: Crystal - we are so happy to hear your experience!  Thank you for your recommendation and we wish you the best!

name: Wrestler Guy
text: The people here are truly amazing and have helped me so much. I can’t thank them enough for all they have done for me. They make you feel very welcomed and go above and beyond to help you. Very Professional but fun at the same time.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Anoynmous
text: Very pleased with my experience at this new clinic. The staff is very friendly and working hard to ensure that all patients are cared for in the best manner. Each therapist has taken their time to get to know me and see me through my appointment, no matter how few or many patients are present. The staff at the door is always so welcoming and helpful! A true joy during difficult times when trying to recover from hurting my foot.

name: Jeannie Bubbett
text: A few days after having bone spurs removed from my knee by Dr. Mark Patterson I began physical therapy at Drayer. I started the day they opened their Alabaster office. As their very first patient I have watched Drayer fill with new equipment and patients in need of their expertise. The atmosphere at Drayer has a very friendly vibe, good humor and easy conversations; everyone truly cares about their patients!  Because of their care and guidance my knee is so much better, and now I have been released with a custom home exercise program to help me improve even more! From the very first greeting I received when I arrived on day one to the last goodbyes from all of the staff, it was an awesome journey back to good health.  I highly recommend Drayer Physical Therapy Institute!

name: K. Trimmer
text: Cannot say enough good things or recommend Drayer PT more strongly. My daughter was battling a serious quad sprain for months. She was evaluated by her therapists until all the dynamics of her injury were known and then a comprehensive therapeutic plan was specifically designed for her. Hours were spent making sure she knew how to do the exercises properly, why she was doing them, and how important it was to continue to do them after she was released from therapy. I feel very confident saying that the therapists were serious about my daughter’s care and dedicated to her recovery. Five weeks after her first day of therapy, she was healed and strong enough to begin conditioning for her ball team. It has been weeks and I am still getting calls from her therapist just checking up on my daughter. Still a pleasant surprise and very much appreciated.

name: Malcolm Johnson
text: The team at this location is AWESOME. They go above and beyond. Seth is an amazing guys and does great work. Evertime I leave I feel like a new MAN.

name: Demeter Reydell
text: Amazing patient care and atmosphere- They can strengthen your quadriceps and turn your frown upside down. 10/10 strongly recommend!

name: Food Junkie
text: The new group in there is great. Sweet staff, very accommodating. They helped me with my insurance, my shoulder, and even called my doctor for me to help set up my follow up appointment.

name: John De Block
text: Great group of PTs that encourage and do everything they can to help you heal and regain strength and functionality.  No need to leave town for PT!

name: SHEILA KIRKLAND
text: Such an awesome group of good folks!!  Carly is really really good at what she does. I don’t say job because it is more than a job to her. She makes you feel like family with her warm and caring way she takes care of you. Thank you Carly and Dr. Stanford for the great care you give.

name: Kandie Sherer
text: P4 is our family physical therapy group. They have taken care of me for various conditions and always leave me better than they found me. I trust them to get me back to action fast and safely.

name: CD Holt
text: P4 Physical Therapy is the best and most caring place for physical therapy, that I have ever been to.  The patient, or client, is always put first.  They listen to your needs and concerns, and pay attention what you have said.  Every time I have talked with them about my therapy, they always have a caring attitude and a listening ear.  This is what any client needs and wants out of their physical therapist.  If I could choose any place to have therapy, P4 and Carly Chaffin would be my first and only choice.  They have helped me through some rough patches with my back pain and problems, and have helped me get through it, with no problems.  If you are looking for a place to have your physical therapy done, choose P4.  They are Number 1!!!!

name: Connie Coltrane
text: I am very happy and satisfied with the therapists and services I have received at P4.  They are always on time and strive to help me with the best of their abilities.  They are experienced and highly skilled.  I will not hesitate to recommend them or go to them again.

name: jamie dozier
text:
Brad and the whole P4 therapy team is amazing.
I highly recommend them.
Guiding pushing and training me to get me in my knee replacement back into great shape

name: Melinda Tasej-Sop
text: Everyone is friendly and makes you feel very comfortable. They answer your questions completely and to the understanding where you know what they are talking about.

name: Jamie Dozier
text: Amazing. Helping me motivating me teaching me and guiding me on my journey of knee replacement therapy. We are blessed to have this therapy team in our area. I personally highly recommend.

name: Deborah Tidwell
text: Brad greets me with a smile and we get started on my therapy. Therapy moves along at a good pace , but always  with a moment to ask how I feel and what my pain level is!   He is very good at his job and has good bedside manners that keep us attentive or laughing!

name: Perry Franks
text: Did a good job

name: Adam Moore
text:
Great knowledgeable staff. Very friendly with great service!!
highly recommend.

name: Jackie & Stacy Baker Music
text: Dr. Moore without a doubt, is one of the best chiropractors I've ever had.  I have been in excruciating pain for several weeks and his ability to so quickly get you back in alignment is consistent.

name: Anthony Johnson
text: Cool and honest. A rare find

name: Don Jackson
text: Where do I begin? During my father’s stay at this facility, he contracted Ecoli and was hospitalized  for two weeks.  Following his hospitalization, an employee of the facility (who claimed to have been looking out for my father) started texting and calling me.  She advised me that my father was receiving inadequate care, that another employee was abusive to patients and that the facility was unsanitary.  ECOLI IS TRANSMITTED IN UNSANITARY ENVIRONMENTS.   The employee then attempted to leverage me for money.  It was classic:  “I am going to look out for your father. He is not being treated well.  I need money..  Let me hold a few dollars.”  The employee actually sent text messages asking for money.  The Director of the facility was advised of the employee’s conduct.  When he was advised, he stated on a teleconference with almost ten witnesses that the employee attempted to leverage me because I was “successful” without accepting responsibility for the employee’s conduct.  Unsanitary environment, telephones that don’t work (even though you are charged for them),   etc.  Since the visitation restrictions were imposed 14 months ago, I am concerned that the quality of care has declined.

name: Just 1 Man
text: Beware of this place.  Your family member is not safe.  They sent my mother in law off campus for an MRI that she wasn't scheduled for and didn't have it documented until the next day and never informed any of her 8 children that they were doing so. If there wasn't so much covering up and lying it wouldn't have been so bad.  Generally I believe in accepting responsibility and moving on to a solution,  but when grown women are lying and pushing the blame, that means this type of thing happens often.   If it had been my mother.... it wouldn't have ended like that.

name: Esi Fante
text: If you can avoid it PLEASE DO NOT go to this place! TERRIBLE!!!

name: Vicki Scott
text: Hillview Terrace is Amazing! My mom loves being there and they are taking such good care of her. We started in Rehab Select and they were great! The Administrator, Business Office, and the Nursing Staff on Oak Station are so so wonderful. They always check on my mom and keep her room clean. They have fun activities for the residents. We couldn’t ask for a better group of people to take care of my mom .

name: Douglas Dunn
text: My uncle was placed here for 14 days after a broken hip.  The center used the COVID-19 pandemic to keep family members from checking on him.  He was left unattended because they said he had to be quarantined.  His surgical dressings were not changed during his stay here.  He was not bathed.  Now he has bedsores, open sores in his groin area, and his surgical sutures were infected.  This facility used COVID-19 as an excuse for neglect.   He is now in more pain and in worst shape than before he went into this facility.

name: Kendra Johnson
text:
This review is for Rehab Select!

The admission process was seamless and the staff was outstanding! Huge thanks to all of you for taking care of my grandmother after a traumatic experience. We greatly appreciate you guys and couldn’t thank you all enough! Would definitely recommend!

Honorable mentions to Ms. Awilda, Audreanna, and Nurse Paige! You guys were awesome!

resp.text: Thank you

name: James Archie
text: Admission process was seamless, way faster than the hospital, the staff was very nice and i was informed of her health condition every day

resp.text: Thank you for your review and i'm glad you had a great stay. We are always looking for ways to make processes work better. Let us know if we can ever be of any assistance.  Thank you again.

text: I had a great experience, great staff and great care, sometimes they took a few minutes to answer the call light but overall very good

resp.text: Thank you for your review and I’m glad you had a great experience. We will continue to strive to exceed our customers expectations.  Thank you again and if we can ever be of assistance please let me know.

text: My loved one received the best care here, the staff is very friendly , and they have an amazing Rehab program!

name: Fred Burnett

text: Very nice and very clean facility. Staff are knowledgable and caring with patients. Had an excellent experience here and would recommend to anyone needing a place for their loved one!

When you gotta go you gotta go !!
This is Rehab select adjoined to Hillview terrace.
This staff here doesn't get in a hurry for anyone. The call button is useless . I experienced this myself not the patient. I'm going to find out a top person to talk to . This was on Sunday afternoon between two and three . Finally got a tech by going to the desk . Oh she came and then disappeared for another ten minutes before actually fixing the problem.
Don't bring your family member here.
Rehab Select

name: Awilda Fegans
text:
I would recommso please with her out come.
— Awilda Fegsns
end Hillview Terrace to all of my Friends and Family...

name: Patricia Carroll
text: If you can AVOID this place at all cost. It shouldn't even be open.

name: Lover Boy
text: I've never been to this place, but I've interacted with a few of the staff at my former job. Those particular ones were rude & had no basic manners. I guess because they wear blue scrubs & work in a clinic that they must think they're above you. One in particular I dealt with named "Marghert" had a very cold demeanor the whole time I was waiting on her, and of course, she didn't say thank you or anything when the transaction was over smh. I won't refer any of my loved ones to this place. If you care about your loved ones, then you wouldn't either.👎

name: Jennifer Dickey
text: This place is a joke. Giving them one star is too much. I honestly cannot believe this place is still open. My mother's care was ridiculous. They never gave her her meds when they were suppose to be given. They all acted like they hated their jobs. They looked and talked to my mom like she was disgusting. I got her the hell out of there and took her to the hospital so she could get real care and they were appalled by her treatment as well. They even tried to blackmail her when she said she wanted to leave (per her surgeon who did not agree with any of her care) and stated that she would be stuck with the bill because Medicare wouldn't pay. I called Medicare myself and they said that's not true. The whole place smells like urine and feces. The rehab lady was rude as hell as well. No one here is professional. I could go on and on but just thinking about this place disgusts me. IF YOU LOVE YOUR FAMILY MEMBER, DO NOT SEND THEM HERE!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Dixie Forever
text:
If your family member passes away at this facility, the administrator sends any funds in the patient account to Alabama Unclaimed Property rather than turning the funds over to the designated family contact.  You will never be able to recover the funds, as the administrator will not authorize Unclaimed Property to release the funds.  The administrator will dodge your phone calls and refuse to communicate with you.  They are ripping off patient accounts.

The nursing home is filthy, needs repainting and reeks of urine.  DO NOT send your family member here.

name: Ann Jac-Gor
text: My mother in law came for rehab from knee replacement surgery. She has dementia, diabetes and the knee surgery.  They along with the insurance company said that they know how to deal with patients with dementia. They complained to my husband that she couldn't respond to their commands and she just sat there...his response was I thought you had the capabilities to deal with dementia patients? The response was "we don't do miracles." Mom had TWO UTIs while there. The second time we came close to the room on Sunday to a foul smell.  I checked to see if she was wet. She was wet and the pad beneath her was wet as well. They sent a culture of urine to be tested on Monday; the result was that she had a Urinary Tract Infection (UTI). By Wednesday they were awaiting prescription orders for her treatment.  My mother in law was transferred from there to another facility the next Tuesday. The UTI was still not treated. The facility where we had her transferred handled the UTI immediately. Dementia gets worse when there is an infection or UTI. She's Diabetic: they told me that they don't have a diabetic diet there to give patients. Well, I asked them not to give her sugar, caffeine, and pork. Her sugar was as high as 300+. When she was home, 118 was the highest unless she cheated then 220. She never took insulin shots; she got them there because they sent it up high with the bad diet, then gave insulin to bring it back down. Diabetic patients are groggy or sleepy when their glucose is up. According to them, she doesn't respond to commands. DUH if her glucose is high and she has a UTI, what the heck do they expect? OH, they don't do miracles! I guess I was talking to a wall when instructions and requests were given!!

name: andrew cook
text: I visited a family member in this facility and couldn't have been happier. Great facility and staff members. I wouldn't mind staying here when I get older!

name: Misael Hacked my account Santos Hernandez
text:
You all need to hire more men because ladies are not strong enough to pick up them people.
And your parking lot is too dangerous. I see why people dont like to visit anyone there because the parking is so difficult you might hit someones car. Hope y'all change how you do things. Thanks

name: Karlito Sway
text: Its depressing as hell to be honest. Why tf would anyone wanna send their loved one to die here?

name: Julianne Hansen
text: Sadly, I visited this facility to see a friend's mother who is recovering from an injury.  She said she hadn't had a bath and that she hadn't been "changed" all day.  Yet I saw plenty of staff gathered around the desk chatting and joking.  When I visited the restroom, a cockroach ran across the floor of the stall I was in .  I am appalled at the conditions here and would not want a loved one of mine placed here.

name: Daniel Bonner
text: My medicine is 2 hrs late every morning. The nurses will argue about something as small as weather I had 1 or two drops in my eyes. Very immature and arrogant nursing staff.

name: lrs 0022
text: Love this facility! good and clean environment

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our location.

name: Lakendra Jones
text: The administrator was nice and very professional

name: Sam Cullen
text: Corn dogs for bypass patient and filthy condition. This place needs to be closed

name: Monica White Hickman
text: Johnson and Hayes has a remarkable PT clinic. The staff is the best! Patient care and rehabilitation is their priority making sure each person is on the road to recovery. My personal PT, Nathaniel, is one of the best! He kept me informed of best practice to help me recover, explained the purpose of each exercise, and made sure I was doing the exercises correctly. The videos they send of your prescribed exercises helped me while I was completing the therapy at home. Thank you all for taking good care of me.

name: Teresa Mason
text: Great therapist, Ethan Hodges!  He really helped with the issue I was experiencing. Highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you, Teresa! We are so glad you're feeling better.

name: Patti Moss
text: A great place to receive personalized attention for whatever needs you have. Kendall is excellent, in that she listens first and follows up with informative information as well as well-thought-out exercises that you can also do at home. It's a non-threatening environment that brings about results!

resp.text: Thank you for your excellent review, Patti! We appreciate it very much. So glad you are feeling better.

name: newsum karen
text: Nathaniel has done an exceptional job at assessing my condition and making a plan to help with my goals as a patient, bringing good results.  He is very kind and caring. I highly recommend going to him  for PT.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the excellent review. We are glad Nathaniel is taking great care of you.

name: Gail Barnes
text: Jack Bice has been great!! I feel like he spent more time diagnosing me than my doctors. He has come up with a diagnosis/plan and it is working. I am feeling much better!

resp.text: Thank you, Gail! We appreciate you, too.

name: Allen Lastinger
text: I truly appreciate the one on one approach to my physical therapy. I like the fact that there is constant feedback and communication that insures I am addressing the issues and healing properly. The entire team at Johnson & Hayes are friendly and helpful in accommodating schedule changes. I hope I never have another experience that requires physical therapy, but if I do, it will be with Johnson & Hayes.

name: wanda canada
text: I am pleased to say Johnson & Hayes PT. are the best. After just a week of PT I am walking straight with very little pain. From the front door to the rear of the facility everyone is professional caring and friendly. I recommend this facility if you need PT treatments.

name: Tamara Lang
text: Best therapy facilty ever!  Everyone is great!  I will not go anywhere else. Jack Bice is an expert and will work endlessly until  a person is healed.

resp.text: Wow - Thanks for the review, Tamara!  Jack is a great therapist and we're glad to hear you've benefited from your partnership with him.  We appreciate you choosing J&H PT for your care!

name: Janis Williams
text: Each time I'm at J&H and leave, I am better than I was when I arrived!    Ethan's questions to me and his notes help focus on the areas of concern, and he gets busy with the next steps.  All the staff are courteous and helpful.

name: Tonjawally
text: I love my therapist, tech’s, and office staff at Johnson and Hayes. Everyone is so kind and compassionate towards their patients and each other. I’ve found I definitely need a little extra kindness while my body is healing and repairing so this is the place for me. ❤️

resp.text: Thank you very much for the review!  We appreciate the feedback and are excited you’re receiving great care from all of our team members.  Thank you for choosing J&H as a partner in your wellness journey!

name: nan pike
text: Ricia is such a wonderful therapist and person. She truly cares about my pain and has a plan to fix it. She goes above and beyond. I feel very lucky to have her treating me.

name: Carla Weaver
text: The staff has always been super nice, the facility is clean. I have been to SportsMed too. J&H is like the Ritz Carlton and SM is a motel 8. The billing is accurate and front of house staff very friendly. Parking is easy.

name: Cathy Simpson
text: I love the way they put you at ease by listening, providing the best treatment and all have a great sense of humor.

resp.text: Cathy, thank you for your excellent review. We are so glad you are receiving excellent care at J&H. We are grateful for you.

name: Cindy Shrader
text: Nathaniel is very thorough and listens, as well as refers to xrays to come up with the right treatment plan for me. I feel safe and appreciated.

resp.text: Cindy, your comments and review make our day. Thank you!

name: Lindsey Wright
text:
Wonderful place.  Professional, kind and caring.
Todd created an at-home program for me.  The link to
my exercises is easy to get to and has a video and explanation for each one so I can be sure I am doing  them correctly.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and comments, Lindsey!  We're glad you're enjoying our home exercise program.  We appreciate you choosing J&H in Huntsville for your care!

name: Angie Powell
text: Johnson & Hayes is an amazing place!  The atmosphere is warm and welcoming.  My therapist, Megan Miller, has been a great listener and very informative. She has always explained each procedure thoroughly and eased me gently back into my regular activities after my calf injury. I have noticed this same care from other therapists with their patients. I would highly recommend J&H to anyone young or old who is dealing with pain or injury.

resp.text:
Angie - Thank you very much for your review and feedback.  We strive to make the patient experience enjoyable throughout every aspect of the therapy experience.  We’re glad to hear that you had a positive experience with the team.

Megan is a fantastic therapist who is very passionate out helping her patients in their wellness journey.  We are glad to hear your partnership with her was successful.

Thank you for choosing J&H for your care!

name: Wanda Meyers-Hines
text: Susan Dupre is an excellent Physical Therapist.  And, she is exceptionally knowledgeable about the human body.  I was in great pain when I arrived for my evaluation appointment.  She was personable, listened intently, and was exceptionally  compassionate and accommodating.  Susan found a work space that was quieter, had a lower light level, and requested that the music be lowered.  I felt hopeful.  In three days my health improved and I am feeling better everyday!  The Customer Service staff is equally great.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review and feedback, Wanda.  Our team, from the front desk to the clinicians, works to operate as a cohesive unit, creating a personal environment for each patient and adjusting the plan of care according to the individual needs and responses of each patient.  We're glad to hear that you've had a positive experience and that you have enjoyed your partnership with Susan.  She's great!

name: Vicki Kendall
text: I’ve had to do therapy several times over the past few years. I have been to a couple of different places until I found Johnson and Hayes. I’ll never go anywhere else again. Jacqueline is the therapist I see and ask for when I get a new therapy order. She is amazing! She is very caring, she listens and I never feel like she is rushing to get me out of the door. She spends quality time with me during our sessions and I always make good progress with the exercises and help she gives me. Also, with all the COVID stuff out there, I am never concerned about cleanliness or about being one on one with the therapists. Everyone is super cautious and careful. Can’t say enough good things!

resp.text:
Wow!  Thank you for the review and feedback, Vicki!  It’s a team effort here at J&H and we are focused on helping our patients get better in a safe and comfortable environment.  We’re excited that you recognize that.

Jacqueline is a fantastic therapist.  We’re fortunate to have her on the team and we are glad that she’s been able to develop and supports plans of care that are beneficial for you.

Thank you for continuing to choose Johnson & Hayes PT for your care!

name: Mech Eng
text: Awesome team of physical therapists!  Ethan Hodges was/is my PT and he is professional, courteous,  and outwardly concerned about my well being.  He's through and takes his time with me during each visit.  All the therapist collaborate with each other as needed making the experience for each patient top notch.  You don't just have the skills and experience of one therapist, you get to have the many years of combined experience at your disposal such that you get the best possible outcome and higher rate of success/recovery.  The open environment of the clinic is neat as well.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you for your review, Mech.  The word, "team" means a lot to us at Johnson & Hayes.  We're happy that you found value from your time with Ethan (a fantastic therapist), and that you also recognized the larger benefit of the collective knowledge of the clinical team. text:
Susan Dupre tested and treated me for vertigo (BPPV).

She made me feel comfortable and never rushed.  Susan also made time to answer all of my questions and concerns that I had regarding vertigo.  She  gave me exercises to perform at home; again making sure I understood how to perform them correctly. I felt in very good hands with Susan treating me and I’m appreciative that she shared with me her vast knowledge of vertigo and the spinning/dizziness associated with it.

resp.text: Joyce - Thank you very much for your review and comments.  We're fortunate to have Susan on the Johnson & Hayes team.  She represents everything that we're striving for in our care for all patients:  Individualized care directed in partnership with the patient utilizing education and a personal touch to both educate the patient and ensure a high level of comfort with the care they are provided.  Thank you for giving Susan and Johnson & Hayes an opportunity to partner with you in your journey back to wellness!

text: I had a great experience with Johnson and Hayes.  I went in after suffering severe pain for 3 weeks resulting from a recent injury. Ethan saw me and diagnosed and treated underlying issue which i had never expected, and after a short session I left with an appointment to return in a week.  The next day I started to realize that my pain was gone and I was beginning to feel good again.  Thanks J&H, and thank you Ethan, for getting me well again.  Highly recommended!!!  Clean facility, friendly and knowledgeable staff.

name: Clay Peake
text: I have been to almost every PT in the city, Nesin, TOC, Sports Med, Mandeville, P3; all working on a chronic knee issue over the last 15 years or so. They all basically have the same set of exercises and similar facilities but J&H just seemed better; better staff, better atmosphere, better equipment. They have the right mix of relaxed attitude but also, hey we've got an hour, let's improve your function today. My therapist Josh was like that, first of all very knowledgeable, relaxed but all business, listened to me but didn't let me drive the train; just struck a good balance all the way around. And actually I learned some new exercises that really helped, and dry needling was a first which I think was the thing that really gave me the most benefit. So anyway, obviously I recommend J&H if you want a no-nonsense approach to rehab in a very welcoming and comfortable atmosphere supported by some knowledgeable, professional therapists.

resp.text: Thank you very much for the review, Clay.  Josh is extremely knowledgable and he works hard to personalize his approach to every patient.  We're excited your time at J&H has resulted in improvement and we look forward to continuing to work with you so you can get back to doing what you enjoy!

I don't take advil daily anymore! So great to be learning techniques that will enable me to have the active lifestyle I want long-term without invasive/expensive alternatives. The front desk folks are also proactively helpful; like any great place, they figured out my insurance coverage, and it has been easy to get in and schedule appointments around work.

text: They are very good at what they do , they have me back 100 percent all thanks to them 💗

name: Tizzy Howard
text: I had a fantastic experience with ATI Troy facility. The clinic is very clean and the staff is both professional and polite. I was warmly welcomed at my first visit and introduced to everyone on the team. Lesley is my therapist and she is great! She is very detailed in every explanation; and extremely motivational while doing the exercises. Today was Day 2 of PT after a partial knee replacement and I am already lifting my leg straight up in the air and bending at 70/90 degree angle. I am satisfied with the care received and will recommend this place to others!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us!

text: I cannot sing enough praises for ATI Troy & the staff. This is my first experience with any form of physical therapy, & I will admit I was a bit nervous. My shoulder is beginning to heal, & I am amazed at the progress!!! I am so thankful that my physician referred me to ATI, & I would not hesitate to recommend them to family & friends.

We will forever be thankful for everything they have done and no doubt refer everyone we know to them!

name: Brigitte Terry
text: What a compassionate, caring and overall friendly staff! With the challenges brought by the pandemic, this office was highly recommended. Convenient appointments have been available, without having to wait weeks or months! If your waiting for pain relief they may have your answer.

text: Beautiful staff, lovely facility. Always willing to work with me.

name: Andrew wood
text: They told me they checked my insurance and I was able to come in three times for free. A $600 plus bill came in for 3 visits. I was thinking they were covered. I can’t afford $200+ a visit. They agreed to reduce the bill but every month it never changed. I called each month to resolve the issue 4 times. I told them I would pay when they would fix the bill like the agreed. When they finally fixed it they sent a letter saying they sent me to collections. The doctor was nice but the billing department is a disaster.

name: Devin Surber
text: Best experience I have ever had. The doctors are patient and understanding and make this experience comfortable and enjoyable. Dr. Spurlock healed my aching knees and got me back to my active lifestyle! He is compassionate and great at his job.

text: Amazing staff and environment! The office manager even helped watch my sick child while I received treatment.

name: Denie Girardeau
text:
My family & I have been using Dr Spurlock for years and have nothing but positive things to say.  He is a excellent Doctor, compassionate and has Neurological experiences as well.
In regards to the billing.  It is a slow process for insurance to pay and I do have a deductible.  The office has been kind & patient whenever there were delays.  The overall treatment and experience far exceeds anywhere else I’ve ever been.
My best advise is don’t live in pain when you can get great help here.  <><

name: Greg Morton
text: I have just finished 12 weeks of therapy on my reconstructed knee, I wasn’t sure what to exspect but, it’s amazing from when I started to where I am today. Thank you Sarah and the team of workers for your talents, understanding , compassion and your persistence to get your patience better! I know this is your job and it’s what your paid to do but, all of you made me feel apart of my recovery, I’m not going to lie and at times it was painful as they pushed me and I thank you for you pushing me even when I didn’t want to be pushed, I enjoyed myself as we worked and had a lot of laughs along the way, I thank all of you in the Gardendale office and look forward to seeing you as I will be doing there wellness program, thank you!!!

resp.text: Greg - thank you so much for your 5 star review of Sarah and the Gardendale team!  Congratulations on your progress and keep it up!

name: Steve Hosch
text: The folks here were friendly and the therapist did good and helpful work, but the reason for the one star rating is simply that after my workers comp prescribed sessions were completed, the therapist told me one thing regarding the condition of my shoulder and told the workers comp risk management people another. This caused me a problem in communicating with the risk management folks about the ongoing trouble and continued pain I was having with my shoulder. As a result, not only is my shoulder problem unresolved, but the further treatment needed for my neck and lower back was caused to cease as well. What this has caused me to believe is that the primary concern of Results Physiotherapy is not for its patients, but more so for their risk management company clients that send them business (patients). For this reason, I have no intention of ever returning to a Results Physiotherapy clinic for any type of physical therapy for any reason.

resp.text: We apologize that our service did not satisfy expectations. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that standard was not met. Please email wecare@resultspt.com for any issues.

name: Patricia Webb
text: The staff at Results PT, Jared was my therapist, worked with me at my disability level and helped me regain a level of function and ability that I am very pleased with.  All the staff are kind and respectful.

resp.text: Thanks for the awesome review. We work hard to satisfy expectations, and we're happy to hear when we help others get better, faster!

name: Cheryl Everett
text: The staff at the Gardendale office are amazing! Tameka always, always has a sweet, welcoming smile waiting to greet you and is always so helpful to answer any billing questions or help with any schedule changes that need to be made..and from time to time will be your biggest fan when you need a cheerleader for support.  And Jarred, my physical therapist was hands down the best! He knows his stuff no doubt! Being a post covid lung therapy patient, I had so many questions and concerns along the way and he listened to me and explained things to me in a way I could understand them and encouraged me every step of the way..never getting frustrated when I’d get discouraged with myself, but assuring me that I was getting better. I am at the end of my treatment and have improved so much from day 1….and I have the awesome staff at Results Physiotherapy to thank for that! So to Jarred, Tameka and Rebecca…Thank you! I appreciate you more than you know!

I hope I never need PT again but if I do it will be at Results in Gardendale.

text: I was terrified "Rehab" sounded like months of pain and slow recovery, I was so wrong I was a new person in days! I'd recommend Phoenix Rehab to anyone, young or old.  Thank you Brent and staff for everything!

Jason is top notch, and even though I thought most of my exercises were stupid, those stupid exercises helped my back feel the best it's felt in years!  Keep up the good work guys/gals & keep those stupid exercises in rotation so everyone can feel their very best!  : )
