resp.text: Thanks Mallory!

name: Hannah Cox
text: Great office staff. Always a great experience no waiting you're seen at your appointment time. I'm usually in and out in 15 min or less.

resp.text: Thanks for your review Hannah! We are glad you are pleased with your visits!

name: Kerri Butler
text: Best chiropractor & staff in town! I always feel great after a visit! I wish there was a 10 star option!

name: Judy Van Luchene
text: Feeling great. After several weeks struggling with some lower back pain, I feel I am finally on the road to recovery. Thanks goes to my super hero chiropractor, Dr. Jason Hart at Hart Spine and Rehab and the Therapeutic Massage Therapist in his office, William (he will make you want to go back every day). If you are in need of some serious help with pain, Dr. Hart is your guy. He is the best chiropractor I have ever been to. Went to Dr, Hart for migraines several years ago but lost track of him when he relocated. So glad to have found him again. He does wonders for my migraines too!

name: Danielle Owens
text: Dr. Hart I love how he takes your ailment and alleviate the discomfort. The staff is always happy to help and fun!! ❤❤

resp.text: Thank Danielle! We always look forward to your visits.

name: Samuel Sternberg
text:
I had been dealing with back issues since I was 23. I went to around 18 different Chiropractors between the time I was 23 to 34 . They were helpful but either couldn't alleviate  the pain or had the worse bedside manner so I was always looking for that one great doctor. I found Jason when I was around 35 because I was working a job that required alot of lifting and carrying of a 28 foot extention ladder over long distances about 15 times a day. I had gotten to the point that it caused me such pain to even bend over to tie my shoes that I couldn't take it.

I found Dr Hart at Sturbridge on Taylor Rd. I saw him therethere for a few years and I followed him after he left to start his own practice because he was the most skilled Chiropractor I had ever been to see, but also because of his regard for people and how he saw the way their wallets and insurance plans were treated. What I mean there without going into a full out explanation is, Dr Jason Hart is one of those doctors you rarely find, he cares much more about you and your well being than he does about your wallet.

I'm 45 now and had it not been for Jason and the lengths he goes to for his patients/friends, to learn his craft inside and out like no other.....well I would still be suffering day to day with a great deal of pain. He is the best Chiropractor in the area and genuinely cares about the people he is treating. I couldn't recommend a Chiropractor more than this guy.

resp.text: Samuel, thank you for your kind words!

name: Monica Townsend
text: The best Chiropractic Office!!!

name: David Montgomery
text: Love this place. Got rid of my sciatica and back pain in just two weeks and gave me advice on keeping the pain away.

resp.text: David, thank you for your review!

name: Rebecca Cockrell
text: If I could give negative stars I would. Staff is inept rude and totally ignorant.

resp.text: Rebecca, we are so sorry we were unable to meet you due to a scheduling conflict with your initial appointment. We apologize that the doctor had to change his schedule. We understand your frustration for any inconvenience this situation may have caused you. Our office takes pride in valuing the time of our patients and will strive to ensure this doesn't happen again in the future.

name: Joy Owens
text: blood is flowing thank Dr. Hart

name: Tom Thompson
text: My wife had a referral there. It has been 3 days and they still have not called back.

name: Tabitha Corr
text: I had a wonderful experience this morning with Dr.Zywicke, her nurse Jarena, and her CRNP Amelia. I had a little bit of a wait but considering they make rounds at the hospital because they are surgeons was to be expected and totally understandable. They both listened to me and checked me out thoroughly. They explained what was going on with me and answered all my questions. I felt like I was their only patient while they were in my room. I am confident when she takes me to the operating room that I couldn't be in better hands. I highly recommend Dr.Zywicke.  she is very nice and she listens to what you have to say!

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Corr. Thank you very much for the 5-star review! We're so glad to read your impressions of Dr. Zywicke and her team and can't wait to share your comments with them. Thank you for trusting your surgery to Huntsville Hospital Spine & Neuro Center. We truly appreciate your support.

name: JJ Parsons
text: Staff here is ALWAYS great. Friendly and well informed on individual cases and I always get top notch care when I'm there. Waiting room currently closed but they do have areas set up with social distancing in mind inside or you can wait in your call and they will call you.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Parsons. Thank you for taking the time to let others know about your experience at Huntsville Hospital Spine & Neuro Center. We appreciate your support as well as your patience with our social distancing protocols.

name: robbie johnson
text: Just returned home from having ACDF surgery by Dr. Jason Banks. First I want to thank Dr. Banks and his staff at the Spine@Neuro office for their professional and friendly help. Next I want to thank the staff at Huntsville Hospital pre-op , surgery and recovery for the care I received there. Its a shame that you cannot receive the same care at our local hospital North Alabama Medical Center.

resp.text: Hello, and thank you so much for taking the time to let others know about your experience with Dr. Banks, Spine & Neuro staff and Huntsville Hospital! We're so pleased to hear your impressions of our surgical services and will make sure Dr. Banks sees this. Thank you for choosing us for your procedure.

name: Amanda Callahan
text: Too bad there is not a negative number I can enter. My mother had an appointment at 1:30pm it’s now 4:05 pm still waiting on Dr. This is beyond ridiculous.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Callahan. We sincerely apologize for keeping your mother waiting and would like to talk with you more about your visit. Please call (256) 533-1600 and ask for the Practice Administrator.

name: Brice Johnston
text:
In regards to doctors/appointments:

This is my second visit and I have averaged well over 3 hours wait time with my actual doctor visit averaging less than 5 minutes. At this point it is almost laughable. I just don’t see any way they can justify this.

Despite the incredibly long waits, the desk staff, technicians, and especially the PT staff have been exceptional. It is a shame they have to deal with these doctors hanging their patients out to dry like this.

name: Jenna Vescio
text: If I could give Dr. Banks zero stars I would. I waited for an hour and he spent less than 5 minutes with me. He had his mind made up about me before he came in the room and he barely let me speak. He clearly has an agenda for who he wants to treat and I didn’t fit the bill. Before he left he told me just keep doing what you are doing, even though I clearly told him it wasn’t working. Thank god I saw another Dr. who is actually treating me like a person, and helping me heal.  I would never ever recommend Dr. Banks to anyone.

name: jeraca M
text: If anyone is looking to get help this is not the place to go! The doctor and nurse will completely confuse you and tell you on one visit that they see things wrong on your mri then on the next visit after having a myleogram they tell you that nothing is wrong and that you are fine!

resp.text: Hello, Jeraca. We are so sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience with us. We would love to talk with you so we can personally address your concerns. Please call (256) 533-1600 and ask for the Practice Administrator.

name: tammy maples
text:
The best of the BEST.
Dr. Banks - changed my life when I met this man!!  Back and sciatic nerve pain "ruled and ruined" my life for several months.  He fixed me, he educated me and helped me to decide the plan of action.
He also has a wonderful team of people working for him 😊 Lisa is my favorite 😊
Dr. Newell - completely different breed of cat from Dr Banks but he knows his stuff!!  He's a physiatrist.   (I've never even heard of this profession before!!)  He's the guy helping me deal with this aging arthritic back, joint pain through injections, medication, exercises.
They get 5 stars.  They are Rock Stars!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review and your thoughtful comments!!!

name: Vivian Wainscott
text: My husband had an appointment to discuss an MRI that showed a problem. The appointment was at 11:00, we was on time, an hour and 45 minutes later we're still sitting here. There are no chairs, you can't go in the office, they will not bring chairs out for their patients, even though it is spine and neuro. They have called in 2 paitent with the same doctor in front of him. The bill was paid as soon as we got here so they have their money whether we stay or not

resp.text: Hello, Mrs. Wainscott. We apologize for your wait to see the physician. A manager from our office will be in contact with you about your concerns.

name: Patricia Mabe
text: Are you going to be open tomorrow 2-15-2021 with this weather coming in tonight.....

name: Joe Atchley
text: My fiance Angie was in a bad car accident and broke her back she doesn't remember the accident, Thank God,she woke up in the hospital after the surgery and Dr. Banks and his physician assistant were there and reassured her everything is ok that was a little over 2 weeks ago and she is doing GREAT she still has pain which is understandable considering what she went through but they saved her life and ability to walk

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Atchley. Seeing comments like yours reminds us why we come to work every day at Huntsville Hospital Spine & Neuro Center! We're so pleased to hear that your fiancee came through the surgery OK and is continuing to improve. We will share your very kind words with Dr. Banks and his physician assistant.

name: Ann Gates
text: Dr Campbell is very professional and at the same time very warm and caring. She takes time o adequately explain things to the patient and help with understanding.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Gates. We are pleased to hear that you had a wonderful experience.  We appreciate your kind words and great review. We will share your comments with Dr. Campbell.

name: Alyssa H
text:
I came here due to neck pain.  On the first visit the nurse practitioner looked at my x-rays and told me I had straightening of the natural curve of my neck.  He didn’t really explain what that meant or what it was caused by.

I spent the next 2 weeks researching neck straightening and waiting for my MRI results.  I meet with Dr Tao and after sitting in the waiting room for 2 hours I finally get a chance to get some answers.  I was very confused when Dr Tao tells me I have a perfect MRI scan and no issues.  When I ask about what the NP told me and noted in my exam history he tells me that it’s wrong and my xrays were fine!

THEN to add to the confusion..two weeks later on the patient portal I read where Dr Tao made a diagnosis of degenerative disc!  I am very confused by all this and still have no answers to why my neck hurts like it does.  I never got to see any of my xrays or MRI results which would have been helpful but I don’t guess it even matters since I got  told so many different things and really given no solution.

And I almost forgot to add...the lady who called to set up my MRI left a voicemail and apparently thought she had hung up when she hadn’t.  I got to hear her complaining about patients on the long voicemail she left.

The only reason I give 2 stars is because the front  desk lady was very courteous and friendly.

resp.text:
Hello Alyssa,
We sincerely apologize for you unfavorable experience. We would welcome the opportunity to speak with you and try to address your concerns. Please call (256) 533-1600 and ask for Administration or Marketing. Thank you.

name: Sheila
text:
Update: I had another opportunity to visit. The process was much better but still delayed - another 3hrs. Still didn't get to see the doctor. I think this is my last visit. The staff yet remains friendly and professional. A much better experience. 2/23/19.
Not exactly sure what or how to feel after arriving for a 10am appointment and not being seen for almost 1hr 40min. The delay I understand, was caused due to discrepancy in insurance verification. The staff did not verify before I came in. This process causes delay and disappointment. Also, my MRI record from ER had not been reviewed prior; so in attempt to open, the doctor could not read or make definite diagnosis/plan - a total waist of time. It was suggested I start with an epidural in my neck - that's not why I was there. On the upside, the front office staff was nice, looked professional and the facility was clean and comfortable. It could be I'm just used to care received from UW, CHI, Swedish groups. I'm just not used to tardiness and nonchalance.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Fore-Williams. We're very sorry to hear that your visit didn't go as expected. We have made the practice administrator aware of your concerns, and she would be happy to speak with you. Please call her at your convenience. The number is (256) 533-8088. Thank you.

name: Valerie Jones
text: This was my first time seeing a Dr here. The wait was not bad so that one positive. I have had back problems for almost 30 years and I have decided to try to get better. Primary Dr sent me for an MRI and then decided to refer me here. Took the disk I picked up from North Alabama Medical Center and was told by Dr. Cho that it wasn't done right so he couldn't see the images. He told me that he would try to get them to send it right and when he could look at it he would call me. He said he would probably send me somewhere else for shots. Didn't explain anything about my report. I thought they did all of the treatments there. Why would he send me to someone else? And why would shots be the only option mentioned? But I guess since he's a surgeon and I don't need and won't have surgery I don't matter to him. He was very abrupt and didn't seem to be concerned about me. I wasted my time driving 2 hours to have nothing accomplished. His nurse and PA were great so that's another positive. But the positives don't outweigh the negatives.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Jones. We're sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience and would welcome the opportunity to work with you to address your concerns. Please call our practice administrator at your earliest convenience. Her number is (256) 533-8088. Thank you.

name: Kalee Sullivan
text: Doctor Banks and his whole staff are simply amazing. I have never met a more caring surgeon. We are so thankful for all the help from him and his staff! Lisa is the primary nurse we have dealt with and she has done so much to keep us comfortable and calm. Thank you Dr Banks and Lisa for everything!!!!

name: Renee Richardson
text: My experience with the Physicians and Staff at the Spine & Neuro Center are nothing more than  positive.  I received the most caring and prompt service/care all throughout my treatment and recovery.  I had to recognize the individual personalities and bed-side manners of my physicians and staff and listen as a patient - this helped me to not only listen but to actively participate in my treatment and recovery.

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Richardson. We are pleased to hear that you had a wonderful experience with our team! Thank you for taking the time to share your story and feedback with us.

name: Cricket Williams
text: I had an appointment on 08/06/2019.  I had no problem with the doctor, however his nurse practitioner was very rude, and had no bed side manners at all.  I was very intimidated by this lady.  She acted as though I was faking my condition, and also made me upset.  She did spend a while in the room with me...I will give her that credit, but her bedside manners while in the room was not shown with compassion and care...she actually made me cry while she was in the room with me. Dr Murray was great the 5 min he was in the room with me, but his nurse practitioner treated me as though she was putting me through a military boot camp...Carmilita Kelly needs an attitude adjustment and learn to have better bed side manners. I know she is not my best friend...but she needs to treat pts with better care and a better attitude.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience, Ms. Williams. Your feedback is important to us, and we have shared your comments with our practice administrator. If you would like to speak with someone about your visit, please call the Patient Advocate at (256) 265-9449.

name: Diane Hess
text: I have never met a nicer, more friendly, congenial or more helpful staff. They have gone beyond and back to help me and I cannot say enough about them. I met Dr. Banks under very stressful circumstances for me & from the moment I met him, he put me at ease & answered all of my questions.  I have moved from Alabama since my first visit but this staff continues to help me more than I could ever imagine. I can never thank you all enough for everything you do!

name: Marla Y
text: I went in with extreme anxiety and fearful over my condition.  Everyone I came in contact with was so nice and helpful.  Dr Banks took time with me and my sister, explaining my problem and the procedure he wanted me to have.  He and his staff are empathetic and caring.  I left there with a hopeful feeling.  Thank you Dr Banks and staff.

name: Kiki Margarita
text: If you are looking for someone who will treat you with compassion and empathy. DO NOT see Dr. Banks he was so rude and dismissive towards me and I will never waste my time or money on seeing him. He was the rudest jerk and the person who happened to take me to the appointment was also a physician whom I am very close friends with. Needless to say she no longer refers anyone to Banks. She was horrified with his attitude towards me and I don’t know him and he had no reason to be that way.

resp.text: Thank you for making us aware of your feelings. We have shared your message with Dr. Banks and our practice administrator.

name: Sherry Wray
text: Dr Banks operated on my husband after he broke his neck in a motorcycle accident.  I found him to be very professional and kind he done everything he could to make our journey to Sheppard's center happen.  If it wasn't for Dr Banks I don't know if my husband would have ever been able to walk again.

name: Melissa Miller
text: While scheduling my appointment, the receptionist told me that it wouldn't take more than a week after my initial doctor's appointment for an epidural injection to be scheduled.  I have a herniated disc.  Extremely painful.  I can't even walk!  I can't walk.   It is debilitating.  I schedule my appointment for 7am.  Dr. Campbell doesn't even see me until 8:30.  Her nurse tells me that the earliest injection she can schedule is January 3.  Just told me I will have to do the best I can til then, because they are closing the office for a few weeks at Christmas.  So I'm suppose to suffer at the holidays.  Very disappointing,  especially since they came highly recommended.  Had the receptionist been honest, I wouldn't have wasted my time.   Now,  I've gotta find a place that can help me

resp.text: Hello, Ms. Miller. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Our practice administrator would be happy to speak with you about your concerns. Please call her at your earliest convenience. The number is (256) 533-8088.

name: Poppa York
text: The doctors and staff have always treated me with the utmost care. I really can't believe some of the snowflake comments. Someone complaining about the TVs in the waiting room. Really? These ratings are  used by people to select a doctor. Some of you people are so spoiled. The care that I received was exceptional. Would I like to have more chit chat time? Probably, but my primary concern was that they help me with my pain. Doctor Tao performed my ACDF and everything went great. Doctor Campbell performed the injections in my lower back. The quality of work was phenomenal. The staff was very friendly. The only issue I have with doctors is that they wouldn't provide me with documentation for the VA, but that has nothing to do with the work they did.

resp.text: Hello, and thank you for taking the time to share your insights about our practice. We're happy to hear that you have been pleased with your care and will make sure that Dr. Tao and Dr. Campbell see these comments. Our practice administrator may be able to help with your documentation request. She can be reached at (256) 533-8088.

name: Terry Jones
text: A year ago I was losing the ability to walk or stand due to spinal stenosis. I spent 10 years going to chiropractors.  At 60 years old I knew i was facing surgery.  Doctors told me my condition was severe. i went to another doctor before I learned of Dr. Derrick Cho. I asked Dr. Cho  an important question, can you help me? without hesitation and with much confidence, he replied yes. I knew my prayers had led me to the correct surgeon.  I highly recommend Dr. Cho his staff and Huntsville Hospital to anyone who finds themselves in need of back surgery.  i have been truly blessed by his knowledge and the work he does.

resp.text: Wow! We appreciate you sharing your amazing story with others. We're so pleased to know that Dr. Cho gave you the hope and the help that you needed. We will make sure he sees your review and knows what a difference he made in your life.

name: Sandy Bentley
text: My Mother who has a lot of medical issues, had spine surgery last Sept 2017, after recover she had no pain.  Dr. Cho was the surgeon.  He did an excellent Job and Meredith his nurse is amazing.  Little over a year later she is having additional back problems, but no fault of theirs, just part of aging and other medical issues.  I recommend Dr. Cho.

resp.text: Hello, Sandy. Thank you for taking the time to share your impressions. We will make sure Dr. Cho and his team see your very nice comments.

name: Charlotte Mulvihill
text: I've had therapy and surgery of the L3/4 spine. I think the experience was a success because I'm much better than I was when I started. I do still have pain but not anywhere near like it was before surgery. I have my left leg working well. I'm now having therapy on my neck. There's no pinched nerve in my neck just terrible tightness. I am due for an evaluation with Dr Newell. Dr Murray, my back surgeon, referred me to Dr Newell after a MRI of my neck. Dr Murray has my complete confidence and his staff is just as wonderful from the receptionist to the nurses.

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review and your thoughtful comments, Ms. Mulvihill. We're so glad that you are feeling better and will make sure that Dr. Murray and his team see your comments.

name: kevin parrish
text: I had to bring my mother to see a doctor here and I can't understand why this place would spend money on TVs, pay for the power to operate them and the cable or satellite if we don't know what is being said on them. I understand not turning the sound on but they could use closed captioning. I ask a lady at the desk but she said they were not allowed to mess with them. DON'T EVEN HAVE THEM IT'S A WAST OF MONEY!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Parrish,

Thank you for the review.  We were unaware that the Closed Caption was no longer showing.  We will get it back up asap.  Thank you!!

name: Heather Conigliaro
text: They will send someone who has had 3 spinal neck fusion surgeries to pain management without performing proper testing such as an MRI or Millogram!!

name: Geneva Cole
text: Dr Banks is the best surgeon I’ve ever known. He’s performed 2 major  Neuro surgeries on me and they were the best they could have been. Thanks, Dr. Banks, for all you’ve done for me. I’ll never forget it.

name: J C
text: They take their time or overbook. Except Dr. Tao he is great and efficient.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Mr. Cody. We're pleased to hear your impressions of Dr. Tao and will make sure he sees this review. We will share your other comments with our practice administrator.

name: barry reaves
text:
After an MRI I had a ruptured disc pressing on my sciatic nerve , the last month have been unable to walk , stand, or lay down without excruciating pain. They were able to make me an appointment with Dr Picket's nurse practitioner Tamika Hays on 6/30, even though everyone's work schedule was overwhelming she was able to work me in for an MRI and schedule me an appointment with Dr Picket two days later. During my appointment he accessed my problems and said he needed to work me in for surgery that afternoon. We went straight to admitting. The entire staff in every department was awesome , caring and so helpful. Dr Picket finished rounds came to the hospital and I was in the OR at 4:00 pm. I woke up in recovery completely pain free and was taken care of by the best recovery team I've ever dealt with. Two hours later I was released to go home , again this morning no pain pills and completely pain free. What a first class faculty everyone went above and beyond to take care of my needs. Dr Picket and his staff was and is an answered prayer. No way I can thank him for his services , his skills , and his dedication.

Barry Reaves

name: Annette Thompson
text:
I can't say enough GREAT things about them of Physicians.  If they were not here I won't be alive today. I won't be walking.
Only negative is the wait time for Dr. Pickett but he is worth it. He is the best and caring about his patient s.  Thank you.😊

resp.text: Thank you for trusting us to care for you.  We really appreciate the kind words.

name: Jonathan Piper
text: Appointment was at 2:45  they closed at 3:30 here it is 4:35 and still in the waiting room along with five other people they said he is running behind on seeing his patients his name is Dr Murray an they wonder why you get irritated I'm not the one who is seeing the Dr an my blood pressure is through the roof right now I'm about to blow a gasket and it's 15 minutes to five

resp.text:
Hello John,
We're sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience and would welcome the opportunity to speak with you to address your concerns.  Please call (256) 533-1600 and ask for Administration or Marketing . Thank you.

name: Kasey Chamblee
text: I never had to wait long so I guess I got lucky there. July 7th I had a car accident and was sent to Dr. Cho. He has no bed side manner and acts like he is inconvenienced when we ask a question. There has been so much to happen I don't even want to type it all. He even tried to argue with me about when my accident was. He tried to dismiss me way before I was ready without therapy or anything. I had to ask if I could try physical therapy. And no they don't even look at all those records you fill out. I won't go into the MRI accident. I think if I had have had surgery I would be better now but NO he is sending me to the pain clinic. BUT his nurse is very kind I don't know how she puts up with him. Everyone else has also been nice.

resp.text:
Mrs. Chamblee,
Your opinion is very important to us.  We apologize that you had a less that satisfactory experience at Spine & Neuro.  If you would like to discuss this further, please give our office a call and ask for the Marketing Department. Discussing the details of your experience may not only clear up any misunderstandings in relation to your situation, but may also help improve the experience of our future patient's.  Thank you.

name: Tommy Townsend
text: I was living in Tuscaloosa before a brain hemorrhage. I woke up days later in Huntsville Hospital Neuro ICU. If not for the surgical skill of Doctor Jason banks as well as the dedication of doezens of staff members, I most certainly would be dead at age 25. I think that deserves a 5 star review.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience Mr. Townsend. Taking call for the North Alabama area is something that we take a lot of pride in.  We are glad that we could be of service to you.

name: DeAnne Emerson
text: Dr. Banks told my husband he should begin drinking to aleave his pain.  He was hateful and unresponsive to my husband's pain!  His license should be removed!  He's a hateful hak!

name: L T
text: I had an appointment with Dr. Banks CRNP, Jason, first so I could get an MRI before seeing Dr. Banks. I only had to wait 30 minutes. He listened to my concerns and was empathetic. I told him I did not want to take pain meds so he offered me other options to make me more comfortable. He was very knowledgeable and answered my questions. I was hesitant about seeing a CRNP instead of the Dr. but I am glad I did. Hope my appointment with Dr. goes as well.

name: Mama Gee
text: The spine and Nero came highly recommended yet when I tried to get an appointment it was next to impossible. The person in charge of making these appointments was extememly difficult to deal with & after a while it became apparent that clearly they don't need patients or else they would treat those who want and need appointments with respect & a helpful attitude. I will be going elsewhere.

resp.text: I am sorry that you had a bad experience.  Please call our office and ask to speak with our marketing representative if you would like to discuss further.

name: Emily Graham
text: My husband was airlifted and brought to HH for a traumatic brain injury and open skull fracture. Dr. Zywicke can be credited with saving his life. She performed emergency brain surgery within minutes of him landing at the hospital and if it had not been for her quick actions, I’m afraid of what the outcome would have been. She was absolutely amazing and her bedside manner was excellent. She updated me every morning in the neuro ICU and then again after we got to the floor. I cannot say enough wonderful words about her as a physician and surgeon.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words, and for sharing your story!

name: Karen George
text: Was and am very pleased with staff and Dr. Tao. Pray it all works and can be pain-free. Many thanks to all of you.

resp.text: Thank you Karen.  We hope that you can get back into the swing of things.

name: Steve Thunder
text:
Dr. Banks saved my life from N. Bacterial Meningitis, within hours if my death and/or living as a vegetable forever. Dr. Banks had just finished an emergency brain surgery on an automobile accident victim that was helow'd in at 10pm the doctor, our hero, began cutting opened spinal cord at my Lumbar all the way up to my neck-decompressing & fussing my spine while scrapping the infection out, them although he had a brain surgery scheduled at 7:30AM, he continued working to scrape the deadly infected pus out if my neck & brain for hours while he was exhausted-I had 6 different doctors/Specialists, but Dr. Banks & Dr. Leyroy Harris (an infectious  disease specialist) were the two docs that prevented me from entering  death's door, I owe my life to them!

Steven Schwartz
SUA SPONTE! From me
Bow-WOW!!! From Thunder, my
Greaf and Mighty WWSERVICEDOG!

name: Stacey Gass
text: I love my Dr which is Dr Murray and he has been my dr for years! He has helped me with pain! And also helped find out back in 2014 along side some other Drs that I had cancer! I love this man this place and I recommend it to everyone who needs anything done to you spine or your neck!!

resp.text: Thank you Stacey!  We appreciate your feedback.

name: Chris Skinner
text:
Worse experience with Doctor’s Office in my life; been two months of hell. Wife was hit head on by a drunk driver April 4th 2015. After being released from the hospital we went to see our family doctor. Our family doctor referred us to the Spine & Neuro Center due to her numerous injuries, back and neck pain. After your 1st appointment with the doctor, they recommend you do their in house physical therapy.  Don’t do your therapy there! Trust me go get your therapy done elsewhere. Michael the physical therapist will evaluate you then pass you off to one of his two aids to do the future therapy appointments. After fourteen physical therapy appointments the pain only is getting worst. So we went back to see our family doctor the 2nd of June. He wanted us to see the doctor again at the Spine & Neuro Center. GOOD LUCK GETTING IN AGAIN. Their appointments are six weeks out. Appointments receptionist gives you excuse we can only see new patients in sooner.  ---- That sounds like discrimination to me! ---- Very disappointed with the Doctor never following up with us after repeat calls talking to the nurse about pain and physical therapy.  Obviously the Doctor has no clue what is going on in the day to day routine in their office.

Finally, they refused to transfer our physical therapy from their in house program to a different company in Huntsville.

name: Linda Schrader
text: Compassionate and caring.  Dr. Banks is a great doctor as is he staff.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the compliment and for trusting us to take care of you!

name: Tanya Penley

name: My Stinkers
text:
Nov 23rd, 2013
Dr. Rhett Murray has no ethics. He doesn't follow the (doctor's medical oath of ethics) to help and treat his patients. Dr. Rhett Murray does not address his patient's questions, concerns, or pain. When asked questions he does not answer the asked questions or inform patient of their diagnoses. He is horribly rude. Dr. Rhett Murray does surgery and then he discharges his patients after their second follow up; without notifying the patient. Dr. Rhett Murray does not help or address patients that are having complications, severe pain, or in need of his medical knowledge. Dr. Rhett Murray's RNs are also rude on the phone. Dr. Rhett Murray has no concern other than making money from surgery. He is known in the medical community of dumping his patients that are having complications and pain on the patient's primary physician. He does not address or help his patients when they are the most vulnerable and of need of his medical help.

name: Jon Bierer
text: The office lied to me about my appointment time, they told me 7:30 am and so I arrived at 7 am to fill out paperwork, Then another patient for Dr. Zywicke went ahead of me at 7:30 and I was told my appt was at 8 am. No one told me I'd have to pay for parking in the parking garage, they gave me 10 pages of questions only to ask me all the same questions once I got in the room. Did you even look at it? I raised my concerns to multiple nurses only to have them tell me they're sorry, but they never said they would look into it or fix it. Dr. Zywicke just told me i needed physical therapy. She didn't provide a diagnosis until I asked, didn't give me a recovery time until I asked. She didn't schedule a follow up visit even though multiple Physical Therapists have asked me when my follow up is because they expected a follow up with the doctor. I went to urgent care and a chiropractor before coming here thinking they would take care of me. I asked for an MRI and Dr. Zywicke refused. I'd rather drive to Nashville than deal with this clinic again.

resp.text: I apologize for the issues that you experienced during your appointment at Spine & Neuro.  Please understand that Spine & Neuro appreciates all reviews and considers all comments, complaints, and suggestions.  Unfortunately, because the review is posted anonymously, investigating the incident properly to resolve the matter is a bit more difficult.   If you would like to discuss this incident further, please call our office and ask for the marketing department.  If not, please consider setting up an appointment with one of the other 5 neurosurgeons in our office.  I assure you that the outcome of your appointment will differ.  Thank you.

name: Justin “GrumpyGamer” Herring
text: Stay away from this place if you can help it! Just make the drive to Birmingham or Nashville where you can find experienced doctors who actually want to help you. I saw Dr. Cho here twice, he's also the new guy they have to write his name in on the appointment cards. The first time I saw him was to evaluate my neck pain and get a diagnosis, then a treatment plan. On the first day they send you to physical therapy, this is just a given with any surgeon exhausting the possibility of anything working before surgery. Then you will also be set up with a pain doctor in their office, which will take you a week to see the first time then a month or two the next time. I expressed that I had no interest in being on pain medication and taking shots to come to find out was not the answer, nor the prescribed treatment for my condition, the only used option was surgery which he will not do because i'm not the most perfect patient for surgery. The condition i have is forminal spinal stenosis and it is advanced to the point over the years that it, as it almost always does, has exacerbated old injuries to my lower back and put me in a ton of pain. Dr. Cho doesn't care if you have a loss of feeling in you limbs, or you are in sever pain, I mean he doesn't even go over your MRI with you in the office, he puts it in his very formal text book response he creates and sends to your pain doctor. If you do any shots don't expect him to evaluate the area because he won't, nor will he do any physical examination to further understand your condition. The most he will do is set there and tell you what he thinks without discussing anything with you and you are supposed to live with it. I had a second and third opinion after my first initial visit, and both out of respect for their profession asked that i return for the second visit with Dr. Cho before I came back to them, because they were sure that he would do the surgery at least on my neck, so I could heal and work on becoming this perfect patient so he could or they could fix my lower back. The second opinion I had wasn't by my choice, it came when I was hospitalized for loss of my bladder and bowl control at my primary physicians office which is concerning especially when I also was having a hard time walking or standing. The third opinion I had locally just to confirm his and the ER surgeons diagnosis. So when i went back i again expressed my extreme disinterest in being drugged up or shot up every week, because two opinions and multiple medical studies i had read by this time all say the same thing. The only thing that fixes my problem with (in any patient) a near 100% rate of success is surgery. You can imagine my surprise when he went totally in the opposite direction. In short i'm scheduled for my surgery next week in Birmingham after seeing one of the surgeons at the neurosurgery center there, who actually had some reservations as to doing it early but consulted with another physician in the room with me (nice to not be left in the dark) and told me the recovery may take a week or two longer but they can fix the issue. Again, In Short save yourself the time of seeing someone who only cares about the money and how long they can keep you taking shot's, pills, and collecting from you and your insurance company. Not to mention i couldn't be released to my job until i was fully medically cleared, and taking pills and shots doesn't get you cleared for normal duty at your job. I've learned to go with my instincts lately with doctors, some you can tell first off if they are genuinely interested in helping you or are just there to collect as much money as possible. (this was my first instinct with Cho, yet i ignored it) and the rest is history, just hope others heed my advice on this guy. REALLY WANT TO GIVE THEM NO STARS, BUT IT WON'T LET YOU!

resp.text: I apologize that your experience did not meet your expectations.  Please call our office and ask to speak with our marketing representative if you would like to discuss further.

name: Gary Rice
text: I am very happy with the whole experience of Mr banks and staff

name: Sarah Maynor
text:
I love this place. I was rear ended Sept 18th 2015, Dr Tao, found out where the source of my pain was coming from and fixed it ONE BY ONE. First, I had a C 6-7 herniation, I had cervical surgery on that level Dec 1st 2015, didn't have to go to therapy or wear a neck brace. He used Glue to close my incision, no stitches, gauze or bleeding afterwards. Totally took away all of my neck issues.

I lived in pain with sciatic and back pain in the si joint region for 8 months. He could have done back surgery and it would've failed, because, it wasn't in the upper spine, but in the si joint above my tailbone. He explained this to me, sent me for injections in the si joint, the injections relieved the pain for awhile. By doing this, he knew, this was the area that was damaged.

I had been reading about the Triangular implants designed specifically to stabilize and fuse the heavily loaded SI joint.  which is called I FUSE. We discussed this procedure, and June 21st 2016 I had it done. It's now 7/7/2016 and I have no pain in my back or tailbone area or legs. The day of surgery, I was laying there before my surgery and thought I would cry from the back pain, when I woke up it was gone.

I was on crutches less than 14 days after the surgery, It's fusing, and I am so glad I found Dr Tao and the Neuro Center in Huntsville Alabama. I would trust this group of Doctors, especially Dr Tao with my life. If you've had failed back surgeries, in pain, please go see him today. I'm glad I did. I am totally drug free! Didn't take any pain Killers after my surgery. Some bruising pain will happen for about 3 days, nothing like the pain I had before my surgery.
Don't be afraid of the I-fuse surgery, at the moment I am walking around on both feet and can't even tell I had surgery June 21st 2015

name: Shawna Tatarchuk
text:
I have been suffering with plantar fasciitis for five years. Being an active person who likes to hike and lives on a farm, I immediately went to the doctor and was referred for physical therapy. It didn't help at all. Over the last five years, I have tried different doctors who have referred me to different physical therapists, with no change in pain level.
At my last doctor's appointment, my primary doctor asked if anything was bothering me and I told him I still had plantar fasciitis. We talked through my experience and he suggested I try a different podiatrist, Dr. Stark. Dr. Stark immediately referred me to Therapy South and asked that I see Robert Harris. I went to the appointment not expecting any different outcome but I am so glad I went! Robert was encouraging, saying he had a plan and he felt confident he could help me. We started with therapy three times a week, addressing first the plantar problem but then working backward to involve the parts of the leg and hip that caused the injury in the first place. Robert gave me four exercises to do twice daily at home and I logged exercise sessions through an easy to use app. Each appointment has been a teaching experience. Robert asks how I'm doing, I tell him how I'm progressing or having problems and he immediately explains and teaches me a stretch or exercise that will help. Robert's goal is to teach me strategies to address problems independently in the future. Each week finds me feeling better, my plantar fasciitis pain now almost completely gone. I am truly thankful to Therapy South!
I recommend Therapy South and Robert Harris for anyone needing physical therapy. They are knowledgeable and extremely professional!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!

text: I injured my back quite severely and they were able to take me through a rehab program that allowed me to return to function without surgery. I am a Certified Athletic Trainer, so from a professional perspective Robert, Emily and the rest of the staff were very knowledgeable. They did a good job of explaining things to patients "in English" while also explaining things to me in the medical jargon I understood. If I were staying in the area and had a team I was working with that needed PT services, I would absolutely refer them to Therapy South without hesitation.

name: Tristan Hughes
text: Absolutely great. They are aware of the science and the office is full of energy, but it's not in your face. This is the third and best PT I've been to. Everyone is kind and very good at their job.

resp.text: Thank you!  TherapySouth Auburn strives to offer the highest quality physical therapy care in our area!

name: Casey R
text:
I came to TherapySouth in 2015 with extreme pain and muscle spasms in my neck and arm due to a cervical disk herniation. The injury happened around 1 year before I became their patient.  During that year, I had no luck controlling the pain with pharmacological therapy, cervical steroid epidurals or a previous round of physical therapy. I found myself in bed and in tears almost daily due to the pain the pain I felt. It affected my schoolwork, my social life, and my ability to do general everyday activities like driving etc.

I was very apprehensive about physical therapy when it was prescribed to me for a second time. The first time around (at a different facility in the Auburn area) physical therapy left me feeling defeated and in more pain than ever. However, after my very FIRST visit with Robert, I knew that TherapySouth was the place to be. He took his time to get every detail about my pain level, mobility, daily activities and most importantly, my end goals for therapy.

He created a workout and therapy plan tailored to my specific needs and abilities.  After every session I felt increasingly better. Nine months later, I am able to do most activities that I want/need/love to do without ANY pain and I have gained muscle strength and flexibility that I so desperately needed.

I really don't know what I would have done without the physical therapists Robert and Emily, their interns, and the wonderful staff at TherapySouth-Auburn. They are all amazing, caring and thoughtful individuals and their skills and knowledge are exemplar. I am so thankful to have been under their care.

name: Tristan Hughes
text: Absolutely great. They are aware of the science and the office is full of energy, but it's not in your face. This is the third and best PT I've been to. Everyone is kind and very good at their job.

resp.text: Thank you!  TherapySouth Auburn strives to offer the highest quality physical therapy care in our area!

name: Charlie Crawford
text:
Over a lifetime of injuries, from motorcycle accidents to on-the-job, to athletic, I have been prescribed physical therapy many times.   A year and a half ago, I could no longer live with my shoulder pain, both sides due to torn rotator cuffs.  My orthopedist said surgery was likely the only way to successfully heal.  I did not want that and asked for a PT referral.  I began therapy at TherapySouth in January 2018 and was surprised at how thorough and caring the folks were.  I was asked detailed questions throughout my initial evaluation and follow-up questions during each exercise.  Robert and Dreher would adjust exercises according to my limits and evaluate my ongoing recovery at each session.  By April, I had almost full motion in my arms/shoulders, pain was gone, and I even could reach around back to scratch my shoulder blades!  All without any NSAIDS or other drugs.

So when I began having elbow pain this year, I asked my doctor for a referral to TherapySouth.  Once again a thorough evaluation of my pain and its source was done by Robert.  By the second session I was already experiencing significant relief from pain that was serious enough to keep me awake at night.  And no drugs!  During my last session, I menbtioned that I also suffered from occipital neuralgia.  Robert did not seem surprised and showed me how complex the relationship with all the tendons, muscles, etc in the back and neck can end up causing pain and trigger points.  Here I am two days later with reduced pain throughout my neck, back, shoulders.

If you are injured, TherapySouth is the place to go for Physical Therapy.  I've literally been to dozens of therapists over a lifetime.  No one comes close to these folks.  If I could give them 10 stars instead of 5 I would do that.  I'm lucky to have found them and grateful for all they have done for me.  I would never go elsewhere.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Angela Fells
text: Know one wants to go to therapy.  However, if you do you want to be treated by people who care. I have been coming here for a while now. I have been seen by every therapist that works here. I am pleased to say, THEY ALL ROCK!!  Even though Dreher can’t sing he makes my day all three days that I come. If you need therapy, Sarah, Robert, and Dreher are all good choices. Congratulations on your upcoming wedding. Angie Fells

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: Jan Sikes
text:
My journey with Therapy South began during the most painful incident in my life----a fall.
Dr. Robert Harris and the dedicated professional at Therapy South brought me back from excruciating pain and walking with a cane to complete healing.
I have returned to them for shoulder and jaw issues and the results have been the same.  They are professional, courteous, caring and highly skilled.  They give attention to the smallest details like warming the electrolysis pads after each therapy session.
Each member of the team has a genuine desire to return their patients to a state of wellness and optimum quality of life.  I highly recommend Therapy South .  I will continue to return to them for all my physical therapy needs….They are Miracle Workers.

resp.text: Thank you!  TherapySouth Auburn strives to offer the highest quality physical therapy care in our area.

name: Nick Boyle
text: I have been visiting Therapy South in Auburn for the last four months. I started my treatments unsure of my particular ailments. Robert and Cody Klein were instrumental at identifying the roots of my pain and improving my orthopedic state. Thanks Therapy South of Auburn Staff.

text: The staff is absolutely amazing. They will push you to get the most out of your rehab experience. They want you to not only get well but to be able to do the things you want to do post injury.

name: Nan Williams
text:
Very professional and caring group.  Could not ask for a better experience.
]Really helped with my problem. I thank and appreciate them all.

name: Warren Smith
text:
I was referred for physical therapy after cervical stenosis corrective surgery (ACDF).  In layperson terms, I needed help to retrain my muscles to function normally after years of unconscious tension and stiffness around my area of pain in my neck.

I was blessed to find my way to Therapy South in Auburn where the staff of PT experts assessed my condition, then developed a plan to get me back to normal, pain free movement and function. The lead Therapy South professionals are DPTs  (Doctor of Physical Therapy).   These professionals impressed me every visit with their deep knowledge of the human body and how to help it recover from injury or surgery.

When I first came to Therapy South, I had neck tightness and pain, leg weakness and very poor balance.  After just a few weeks, the staff at Therapy South helped me with treatments and exercises that completely removed the pain, dramatically reduced the stiffness, and helped me make huge progress in returning to normal balance.  I feel so much better about my physical health today because the team at Therapy South delivered effective care and treatment.  They have the expertise, the facilities and the patient first mentality to make a big difference in therapy for improvement in quality of life use of the body.  Without reservation, I recommend Therapy South to anyone in need of help to recover lost or limited physical movement, or relief from pain.

name: John Tipton
text:
I don't always fall off of my motorcycle, but when I do I head to this Therapy South location. The doctors and staff are fantastic. Scheduling is painless and flexible. Dr Chris explained the mechanism and anatomy behind each treatment and excercise. Shoulder was 20/100 before treatment and today every bit of 95/100.

Thanks to the team.

name: Kayla Anthony
text: One word to describe this place- AWESOME!!   Chris and his whole staff are excellent! They always take great care of me and the service is always amazing!  I highly recommend them!!  😃

name: Brayden Blythe
text: The staff helped me fully recover from ACL reconstruction. Could not have done it without their hard work and dedication to make me better.

resp.text: So glad to hear you fully recovered following your ACL surgery.  It was a pleasure working with you!

name: Brice Jackson
text: Chris & Andrew are fantastic! Thank you both for your kindness & expertise.

name: Corbin Ellard
text: Absolutely love this place! Chris and Corey did a great job. I was having trouble with my left elbow, which was such an uncomfortable spot on my arm and they got it all sorted out. They will be the only place I refer people to when it comes to PT

resp.text: Thank you Corbin!

name: Brian Black
text: Great Staff! Recovering from hand surgery and they have been great! Would definitely recommend them for physical therapy!

resp.text: It was a pleasure working with you Brian!

name: tesla nichole
text: I visit TherapySouth Riverchase periodically to receive Dry Needling therapy. The entire staff is so nice and professional, and the facility is clean, open and welcoming. Chris always takes great care of me each visit. If you're looking into physical therapy I highly recommend Chris Allison and the entire staff at TherapySouth Riverchase!

name: lauren philen
text: I had an excellent experience at TherapySouth Riverchase.  Chris and Corey were both very knowledgeable and helped me tremendously in my recovery.

resp.text: Lauren, that is great to hear!  We are excited that your goals for physical therapy were met.

name: Christina Van Der Hulst
text: Service is great! Very attentive and always happy to answer any questions/concerns! Highly recommend them!

name: Katrina Chapman
text: I had two surgeries before the age of 20 because of wear and tear from over a decade of swimming. Both were done by the same surgeon. My first surgery was in November of 2015. I did physical therapy at another Hoover clinic (not a therapy south) and I grew to hate physical therapy, physical therapists, anything associated with them. I honestly believed the profession was a crock because of the poor care I had received at that clinic. I didn’t know any better! My hip never got better, it was much weaker than before, and three years later, is still in pain and lacking the function I had prior. My skepticism towards physical therapy as it turns out, was just because I went to the wrong place. After a shoulder surgery in May of 2016, I was referred to Chris and Corey from a friend and my outlook could not be more different now. Not only did they cater my shoulder rehab to my specific sport (weightlifting), they also helped me repair my hip and alleviate some of my pain. I’m a true believer in physical therapy now, even going as far as changing my career path so I can also change someone’s outlook. Chris and Corey go above and beyond for you and Lauren is always a friendly face when I come into the office. I can’t say enough good things. Thanks y’all!

resp.text: Thank you, thank you!  It was a pleasure working with you!

name: Melissa Bryant
text: I could barely walk and had pain every day. I came to Therapy South Riverchase and Chris and Corey helped me progress all the way to running marathons! Thank you so much!

name: John Hunt
text: Chris and the staff are committed to getting you back to break condition.

name: Matt Snow
text: Friendly staff, clean facility, professional care!

resp.text: Thanks Matt!  It was a pleasure working with you!

name: Logan McNaughton
text: I have been to Therapy South for multiple injuries and the team there is always welcoming and make you feel at home every time.

name: Benny Cunningham
text: I have just completed several weeks of PT for a shoulder issue. The staff at Drayer PT are friendly and professional. I am thankful for them. Also were flexible with my schedule.

name: Rebekah Yarbrough
text: We loved Drayer!! Haley was so great with my son!! Very patient and you could tell she really enjoyed helping him!!! The staff was excellent!! Keep up the good work!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much Rebekah!  We are so happy that you are happy and we wish you and your son the best!

name: Leslie B Davis
text: Everyone was so friendly but very professional. I will go there if I ever need PT again.

resp.text: We hope you don't need us Leslie, but if you do, we will always be right here for you!

name: kym klass
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here, and feel I was in the most capable hands with Dakota Hooper as my physical therapist. He was patient, honest, and took care of my hip flexor injury with the utmost care. I appreciated both the exercises and hands-on treatment, and know I benefitted greatly in the time I was treated at Drayer from the entire staff. By the time I left, it felt like family.

resp.text: Kym - we are so happy to hear about your results and your experience.  Thank you for the shout-out to Dakota and we welcome you as part of the family!

name: Dorothy Lippert
text: Wonderful staff. Conscientious about the health and well-being of each individual. I highly recommend Drayer Physical Therapy to anyone needing their services. Convenient location close to shopping!

resp.text: Dorothy - thank you for your 5 star review!  We may be biased, but we think they are pretty wonderful too :)

name: Jennifer Sexton
text: I would highly recommend Drayer Physical Therapy!! All of their staff is very friendly, helpful, caring and knowledgeable. They make you feel at home from the second you walk in the door!! I’ve always been greeted with warm welcoming friendly hellos and they know every patient by name.It’s like being part of a family. I always look forward to my appointments knowing that I’m getting the best care there is!! Thank you Drayer!!❤️

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

Their therapists and support staff have always been very motivating in my sessions, very knowledgeable in their field, and accommodating in scheduling. They have always been available with any assistance. I highly recommend their services!

text: Amazing people who are very supportive and nurturing. They go above and beyond to assist you in reaching your physical therapy goals. They take time with you to explain and discuss your treatment, and they know you by name. I have never cone in and not been greeted by name. They are absolutely fabulous! I have recommended them to friends and family, and recommend then for anyone in need of physical therapy.

text:
I’ve been going to Drayer Physical Therapy in Prattville for only three weeks now and I feel like there IS hope after all! The staff have been so gentle with their approach & professional with explaining every step along the way of my recovery.
I would highly recommend them to anyone.

name: King Cowza
text: The Drayer staff are all very knowledgeable and friendly. They explain your treatment to you and answer any questions that you may have. I’ve had a lot of mixed experiences at various Physical Therapy locations but I can honestly say that Drayer is easily the best that I’ve been to. The staff work as a team and make it an enjoyable experience.

name: Kaylee Grace Simmons
text: I love this place! I will definitely recommend this institute to others. They treated me amazingly, with so much care. This is one of the places where you’re working towards your goal while having fun. I went in for back problems and it took no time for them to help me. I feel so much better. (I took absolutely no medication while in therapy) If you’re reading this review and thinking about going to Drayer Physical Therapy Institute for your isssue, definitely go.

name: Susan Blalock
text: I have been treated with respect and care for the past few months. They are willing to work with your schedule as well as your care to make sure you get what you need to make your recovery as smooth as possible.

name: Kara Mowatt
text: Wow! A PT office that I actually look forward to coming to 3 times a week. I am a huge fan!! From the front office staff: Melissa and Ashley, to the techs, to every therapist, everyone is outstanding!!! I have experienced numerous physical therapy offices throughout the years and Drayer in Prattville is hands down THE BEST!!! I'd like to add a special shout out to Joanne and Hailey!! I am walking again after major surgery with a big thanks to these two truly incredible therapists ❤️

name: Chrissy McCandless
text: I can't say enough about this place. The staff are wonderful and extremely caring and knowledgeable. The facility is very clean and open, it does not feel as though you are "packed in" and overly crowded like most places. I have been to a few other therapy centers over the fast few years, and they are by far the best. I chose this location because I heard about a treatment called, dry needling. I have 2 herniated discs in my cervical spine and I have tried everything to relieve the pain from massage therapy to multiple steroid injections, a nerve ablation and even CBD oil with no relief. I am currently scheduled for my 2nd cervical fusion surgery in a few days, and prior to dry needling and this round of physical therapy, the pain in my neck and shoulder was at an 8 out of ten on the pain scale. I chose dry needling because as anyone with cervical spine issues knows, the knots in your upper back and shoulders are ridiculously painful. Today is my last day of physical therapy, in just 9 sessions of therapy and 4 dry needling sessions with Haley, my pain level went from an 8 to a 2, which is amazing. I would highly recommend Dreyer Physical Therapy to anyone seeking relief from pain. They are miracle workers.

resp.text: Thank you Chrissy!

name: Mackenzie Glass
text: I actually love coming to therapy at Drayer! The staff is always friendly & they know exactly how to help. Thankful for everyone doing everything they can to get me back on the court!!

name: Heather Rothermel
text: Awesome staff, everyone is friendly and truly care about helping patients get better. Came here after both of my surgeries to recover. Highly recommended!

name: Janet Mary Lee
text: I am in PT for my shoulder, hoping to avoid surgery.  I have had amazing results and wonderful care. I honestly would go no where else! The therapists treat you as their only priority, no matter how busy. They are gentle and extremely competent, as well as encouraging. The office staff are superb, knowledgeable and very efficient, and helpful if you must reschedule your times, as going three times a week can be very hard in today's hectic pace. I will use this place again, if ever need be.  The other people I talked to during my therapy feel the same way. They become like family very quickly!

text: Couldn't ask for a better staff. Each and every PTA and PT are amazing and very helpful. Definitely highly recommend this location to anyone in need.

AHumphrey

text: In November 2017 after a left knee joint replacement, I received physical therapy services (at TherapySouth Talladega, AL).  The results were very good. Regarding the services provided, they are prompt, patient oriented, and well informed.  While receiving the services, they provide for a relaxing, pleasant, cordial and clean environment.  I would definitely recommend TherapySouth.
